reviews.text: It pains me to do this but here it goes.. I am a fan favorite of the Cheesecake Factory however, after two failed attempts at takeout, I had to vent. I work downtown and grabbing a salad  is my go to. The first time I placed an order for their Cobb, I was shocked; there was primarily lettuce and only minimal on the toppings. I&#39;ve had the salads many of times dining in and it&#39;s always plentiful.<br><br>Last week, I ordered the Chinese chicken salad and when I opened the container, there were the crispy white noodle (sorry not sure what the name is); chicken looking like it had been sitting and ... a ton of lettuce. There was only one dressing and there should have been two. It was the driest, most disappointing salad. After a few bites, I threw it away. <br><br>I&#39;ve decided not to order out again and when it reopens, after some time, will dine in. It&#39;s two disappointing times and it seems the quality is very different when you pick up/ take out vs. dine in. <br><br>Outside of that, the staff there are very nice and professional!

This location has been here for years! Always busy but you can always shop while you wait. <br><br>Pasta Da Vinci- my favorite pasta from here. The chicken, mushroom, onions blend very well together in the wine like sauce. I liked that it came out piping hot however the pasta was just a few minutes undercooked. <br><br>Since it&#39;s always busy, servers are usually all over the place but understandable. They have two floors for seating. If you don&#39;t like loud noises I wouldn&#39;t recommend sitting out by the host area because of the show that plays on the hour or so.

I&#39;m from Texas and we have our fair share of Cheesecake Factories, but this is the best one I&#39;ve ever been to. The quality of the food was superb for a chain restaurant. I&#39;m convinced that they used fresh ingredients. Even if they didn&#39;t, they put some type of magic in their food!

Always great food. We love to come here adtet a long day of playing with the mouse.  They are open late and never make you feel rushed because of closing.  Unlike another shrimp place just down the street.    I woukd suggest this restaurant anytime.  My go to meal is the scampi.  The best around.  <br><br>You can even have it togo. Nothing like fine dining in your hotel room.

We celebrate most of our special occasions at the Cheesecake Factory. We were happy to see that we could have take out of our favorite items. We enjoyed our Anniversary dinner at home during the pandemic phase  in Las Vegas. I mentioned our special occasion to the hostess. Surprise! A wonderful chocolate bar with Congratulations written on it. Thank you Cheesecake Factory for making our<br>39th Anniversary, a memorable one. <br>And very TASTY, as usual!! <br>We also had the Chicken &amp; biscuits and <br>Steak Diane, yummmmmmmmm!!!!!<br>Now we&#39;re coming back for take out when not <br>a special occasion, it was great!

I&#39;ve been a fan of The Cheesecake Factory for years. Which is is why I felt more a reason to write my review of how disappointed I am. I&#39;ve celebrated a few celebrations here, with huge amounts of people in the party, and this by far was thee worst! <br><br>We had our company &#34;Bringing in the New Year&#34; dinner last night. Mind you its was a party of 20. Reservations were made for 7pm, so its not like they weren&#39;t aware. Let&#39;s start off that we had one server for the whole party. She did the best that she could, with only serving us all by herself. So no complaints with our server. It did take 25 mins to get our drinks. After eating baskets of bread, you can imagine how parched we all were, frustrated that we didnt even have water to wash it all down. Finally our drinks came out, but haven&#39;t been asked yet if appetizers were wanted. It took another 20mins for the appetizers to come out. Yes! We were all happy to have a little something to hold us until our entrees. <br><br>Now this is when the whole entire table started to get irritated and pissed at this point. Half of us were starting to fall asleep! It took AN HOUR! One whole hour to get our food! What&#39;s more sad is that we all literally took a few bites and one by one we were all asking for box to take our food home.  We all ordered a cheesecake as well, and the server even knew to just pack them all to go. We didnt get out until 10pm. We spent most of our time waiting. Let&#39;s just say the doctors and boss will not be booking our next company dinner here. We were all so disappointed.

Consistently delicious! Our server was super helpful and had great recommendations. We tried the chipotle pasta, taco salad and roasted artichoke. Our food was running a little long and the manager came over to apologize. She was genuine with her apology and said they burnt the artichoke and had started a new one for us. That was really awesome that they actually cared to not send out food that was poor quality. This isn&#39;t our usual location but will definitely be back! And don&#39;t forget to get dessert!!

Great customer service from Daniel, my husband and i we went to the location on Charleston outlet, and Daniel the server was awesome. He really explain every question we had about the food, and he really knows about customer service. Of course we&#39;re going back!

The Cheesecake Factory never fails me. Today was no exception.<br><br>First the food. The Tuscan Chicken packs a wallop of flavor into 560 calories. The blend of artichokes, capers and tomatoes is lip-smaking good.<br><br>The Asian lettuce wraps were good, but nothing to come back for.<br><br>What was most outstanding--what really made my experience special--was Heidi. She&#39;s truly a gifted waitress. Despite having many tables, she made me feel like I was her only customer. She has a preternatural ability to predict what I wanted before I asked. <br><br>The CF isn&#39;t fancy, but it has a relaxing vibe, some great  entrees, and one awesome waitress.

I just love this place,  I recommend the pear goat cheese salad, cheeseburger egg rolls so yummy and the rock shrimp bistro  pasta. Also had the celebration cheesecake which was good but I&#39;ve had better there. I love the lively atmosphere happy atmosphere and always get great service.
Always a must when coming to the outlets! Amazing food better service! And THE BREEEEAD

If you&#39;ve ever been to the Cheesecake Factory, you know their menu can be daunting. Today, I feel as though I solved the frightening large menu conundrum.<br><br>Firstly, we waited about 15 minutes for a table for two. Which made sense as it was 5pm on a Sunday right after a matinee at the Smith center had finished. The three ladies at the hostess station were rockin getting people seated in an efficient manner. Now, one is never mad when they have to wait because now you just stare and find the cheesecake of your dreams for dessert.<br><br>Once we were seated our waiter Ruben came by! He brought us our waters and could tell we weren&#39;t ready with our order just yet. We just couldn&#39;t decide what to order and instead ordered four different small bites/appetizers and got to have a little bit of everything. We had the fried zucchini, fried crab bites, roadside sliders and the potstickers. We just shared them and got to eat a bit of everything! For dessert we of course got cheesecake - I had the cookie dough cheesecake and he had the Reese&#39;s cheesecake! Of course, we did have to take half of those home because we were stuffed.

With guilty pleasures of all forms prevalent in Las Vegas, my personal guilty pleasure is food -- and the chain restaurant of the Cheesecake Factory, as I mentioned in a previous review from another Favtory location! Infamous for being one of the most ridiculously unhealthy restaurants in the States ( with many of its foods clocking in at over 2000 calories by themselves, and that&#39;s not including the cheesecakes they&#39;re famous for! ), I still enjoy it enough that it&#39;s worth the calorie binge just to indulge in cheesecake.<br><br>As I was in the area for a work-related function, I stopped into the Factory location at the Outlet Shopping Center for lunch -- which was just as well, since I managed to get seated before the lunch rush arrived! As for the food, I ordered the fried macaroni and cheese, the soup of the day, the Factory combo of chicken Madeira and steak Diane, and the mango and key lime cheesecake.<br><br>Per the usual, the Cheesecake Factory provides complementary bread for one to munch on while waiting for the food, and it is quite tasty, though I admit I didn&#39;t eat too much of the bread as I intended to save room for my order. The fried macaroni and cheese was the first to come out, and it was crisp, flavorful and indulgent! Perfectly gooey, as well -- as macaroni and cheese should be!<br><br>With regards to the soup of the day, I was told it was a chicken and vegetable soup. However, it came out with tortilla strips, so it was chicken tortilla, and then I found potatoes and rice in it, which is... not typical of tortilla soup? I will admit, I tried to like it, but I was left more confused about what kind of soup it was. It was not to my liking, to put it mildly.<br><br>The Factory combo I ordered had one of my personal favorite items on the menu -- the steak Diane -- so of course I enjoyed it immensely, but the chicken Madeira was also very good and surprisingly light despite mozzarella cheese being among the chief ingredients of the dish. I polished as much of the plate as I could, though I didn&#39;t finish the potatoes since I wanted to save enough room for dessert.<br><br>Of the numerous cheesecakes on offer, this time I went for the mango key lime cheesecake for something different and more tart than the usual. The acidity of the lime and the sweetness of the mango -- plus the surprise coconut macaroon crust really made this a spectacular and somewhat lighter option of all the cheesecakes on offer. Props to my server for recommending it!<br><br>The Cheesecake Factory is popular enough here in Vegas that it has multiple outposts in the City. However, one of the things I noticed is that it took a while for my server to get back to me with my orders -- which, while understandable during the latter part of the meal due to more diners coming in, it was noticeable early on when there wasn&#39;t that many people in the restaurant that they were really slow. That plus the miss on the soup of the day means that this location only gets three out of five stars for me. While I love to come in on my cheat days, I think I&#39;ll just stick to my personal favorite Factory location in the District...

I&#39;ve never been to cheesecake factory before this visit and I had read the reviews before coming and was kind of worried about the service I&#39;d receive but everything was grade A from the food to the service. <br>I really loved my chicken carbonara which didn&#39;t feel that heavy at all for a pasta and the tuna poke bowl was such a treat. <br>We came at around 9:30 PM and really enjoyed our experience with out server and with the quality of food we received. Definitely will be coming here again sometime :)

I got some cheesecake slices to go from here &amp; the taste was so good. However the portion size was so small.. they literally put extra whip on the side to fill in the empty space ... I was shocked &amp; disappointed at how small they have made their cheesecake slices. I spent $18 for 2 little pieces... just imagine how much they make off 1 whole cheesecake selling small slices . $9 a piece.. they got to have at least 10 pieces ! That is insane
Blah blah and more blah. Cold food missing the chicken off the fettuccini. Bread not warm and very hard. Definitely not what I remembered this place to be

I love coming here one of my favorite places they have a great selection menu not only are you able to grab a quick delicious lunch or brunch with a friend but you can also do a little bit of shopping while you&#39;re there if you are doing a last-minute birthday gift or any type of gift I love this location one of my favorite places to come to maybe 3 times a week love doing birthday dinners here. The only thing is that I wish that they could sit more than six people as sometimes I have a party of 9 to 10 people but other than that this is a great place to come to and have a delicious brunch the mimosas here are also delicious along with  menu I highly recommend coming here if you love having the options. If you have never tried this location I highly recommend it it&#39;s very delicious as the rest of them here in Las Vegas.

I like this restaurant because they have so many options. Portions are a great size. It cost a little bit but portions are massive. I think my favorite part about this restaurant is the house salad. I got the side portion and it was so big. They have lunch specials which is a great price.

First time going to this location. Had the reservation for Oct 29 for my twins bday, customer service was okay. When we came in the server that was suppose to serve us sat us and never acknowledge us afterwards, his shift was almost done he looked very upset because the persons that was supposed to cover him was not there yet. I would&#39;ve gave them a 2-3 star if the next server wasn&#39;t pleasant! But he was :) I forgot his name but if he reads this you know who we are! He was fantastic! The food was great like always.

Great happy hour options. Happy hour is M-F 4pm-6pm ONLY in the bar area this includes booths in the  area which are not open seating but fortunately the bar itself and the high tops are first come first serve.<br><br>My favorite drink on the happy hour menu is the cosmopolitan, it also has a &#34;skinny&#34; option for only 110 calories...winning!!! New year, new me! Lol<br><br>Service was quick and fast. I met with a friend and we had 5 appetizers and 2 cocktails for only $45. The menu had a lot of variety and they didn&#39;t skimp out on HH. <br><br>Parking for locals in the  nearby garage is free with valid local ID. The valet is directly in front of the restaurant which is $8 this is for the entire mall not just Cheesecake Factory.

I love going to cheese cake and is a place me and my boyfriend go for a cute date! Tonight we went to our favorite little spot and get my favorite plate, which is the Thai lettuce wraps. Well 5 minutes later I see ant or spider on my lettuce crawling around!! We called the manager and he took our plates right away, just for him to ask us to pay for our drinks!  We left a tip to our great serviced server. But please check your lettuce if you get them I couldn&#39;t believe my eyes! Thanks cheesecake!

Horrible horrible horrible experience! My food was extra dry I asked for extra sauce they never gave it to me . The other food I order looks like a kids menu and they cut up my steak when it&#39;s supposed to be whole . 50.00 bucks on food and it looks nasty and doesn&#39;t taste good at all called the restaurant spoke with manager Sarah who said her hands are tide up and it&#39;s nothing she can do about it what kind of manager says that and my food looks like this I asked if I could get my money back she said NO definitely won&#39;t be back to them

Amazing combination of quality and quantity. The Southwest pasta with chicken tasted great. The chicken and shrimp dinner was delicious. The Thai chicken was fantastic. And, all three of those plates could have easily fed two people. The service was also perfect. We had a superb evening! Thanks!

Had an amazing dinner with the family thanks to Devon.  Yes, there was a long wait. Yes- it is HOT. Yes, there&#39;s not much they can do about items that sell out since we are in weird times and they are doing their best. We came on Sunday and enjoyed our service. They ran out of my requested miso salmon and I asked devin to put in a &#34;surprise&#34; for me. He did it RIGHT. I will be ordering the da Vinci pasta from now on. Wowwww love. Please people stop being so mean to people that are trying their best just to survive and make it by. You are not royals.

I Frequent CheeseCake Factory Often. I Have To Say I Wont Be Back After The Quality Of The Food As Disappointed On Numerous Occasions. The Pasta Carbonara Should Be Taken Off The Menu Entirely Due To Lack Of Flavor And Being Charged $5.00 For A Half Piece Of Chicken Breast And Broccoli Pieces You Could Count! The Kitchen Manager Should Re-evaluate His/Her Line!

Came if for a family dinner.. They were great with getting us placed near one another since we had a party of 7. Our waitress Sarah was amazing. She was helpful and sweet and very attentive to us.. The food was amazing. The portions were good sized. The pastas were nicely sauced. We look forward to coming back, and hopefully having Sarah again!

Very attentive staff, got service immediately at a bar table. I had the Jambalaya with brown rice! It was spicy, but I enjoyed it! Sister had the Chicken Alfredo and she loved the sauce and she had plenty of bread for dipping! My brother-n-law had the spaghetti and meatballs, we had mentioned how big the order when talking about the portion sizes and I guess it got stuck is his mind cause he know exactly what he wanted! My fiancé got the Salmon as usual and we were very happy is was not over cooked! She topped it off with her favorite Key Lime Cheese cake!

Let me start by saying after a horrible day shopping at the north premium outlet with the horrible customer service , a visit to the Cheesecake Factory was warranted.The greeting staff is great .But my server Dee was spectacular! She took time to go thru the menu.<br><br>Avocado Rolls<br>Lemon and Garlic Shrimp (from  Skinny Menu) 500 calories <br><br>My meal was topped off by Carrot Cheesecake. I wont<br>put the calories because I&#39;m too embarrassed but I was so happy to eat it!<br><br>Great service <br>Great food<br>Great place to eat after a rough day of shopping.

Had made a reservation and still had a little bit of a wait but it wasn&#39;t too long. Food and drinks were amazing and so was our waitress. Friendly staff and great food! Bathrooms were super clean as well.

We went here to celebrate a birthday. We checked in at the front table which was half inside, half outside holding open the door for some odd reason. Guess it was some kind of social distancing thing. We were placed on a wait list and given an approximate 30 minute wait time. Do to the social distancing and limited seating we were told to leave a phone number to be text when our table was ready and to wait outside. We found a bench around the corner to hang out while we waited. We finally received the text that our table was ready and went to the front table. They rudely asked what we need in which we replied that we had received the text that our table was ready. The hostess seemed confused. Two other groups showed up having received text messages as well. The hostess returned and told us that we had to wait by the door and someone would be right with us to take us to our table. 10 minutes, 10 MINUTES later we were greeted by a host and brought inside out of the 100 degree direct sun light!!!!!!! By the time we sat down at our table all we wanted was a cold glass of water. Sadly it took our waiter an additional 5 minutes to make it to our table and ask what we wanted to drink and an added 10 minutes to get the glasses of water. What?!? We placed our order as soon as we could in fear the waiter Pilsner return promptly. Our food came surprisingly quick. Nothing super to report on that, it was good but not out of this world. Sadly we didn&#39;t have any room for dessert. We got our bill, paid and left having had a mediocre start to a birthday celebration.

Food is outstanding, menu very diverse, didnt like being taken to back seating area where it appeared they sit all families with children, our server left me a little more to desire by valentina, ordered coke, she gave me diet coke, she said sorry, ordered white rice and was given brown rice, we ate it only for reason because she took ten minutes to check our table once it was served..again she apologized, when she finally checked our table we advised her of the error and she actually went back to check her written ticket to verify we were telling the truth,  it would have been the perfect visit if she was able to handle the 4 tables she was sat. Not sure yet if i will return, again food is amazing!!

We haven&#39;t even been to the restaurant yet and already I am not impressed with the service. The reservation process is a joke and I&#39;m not sure if the people manning the phones really care whether you dine at their restaurant or not. I will add to this review (maybe changing my rating) once we&#39;ve visited and experienced the meal and service. Stay tuned.
One of our favorote restaurants. Huge menu with great options that never disappoint. We ordered online &amp; it was ready as stated. <br>03082020

The staff was absolutely amazing! Our waiter was one of the nicest waiters I have ever had. She would check up on us, she would refill our drinks right away, and she is so well mannered. It was the first time my friends and I went to this Cheesecake Factory location. It was worth the drive heading there. The chicken fettuccine Alfredo was perfect. 10/10 would recommend.
I enjoy the cheesecakes and non-alcoholic drinks here. Each of the entrees on the menu are delicious. I once had a Godiva cheesecake which was good. The lemonade is fresh and excellent!

I love going to the Henderson location.  We were able to reserve patio dining via YELP, so everything went smoothly.  I don&#39;t like the option to view the menu via the QR code, but other than that fantastic service and good food with amazing portions.
Slow slow slow slow was the food was fine. Manager didn&#39;t even show up to apologize. Margarita pizza literally had 3 leaves of basil and 3 small pieces of cheese.

Great Factory Burrito And Service From Jose<br><br>The Factory Burrito: this is my go to and has been for over a decade whenever I visit any Cheesecake Factory locations. Ask for extra sauce and you will no be disappointed. It is enough food to fill even the hearties and hungriest of appetites! <br><br>Jose The Server: Jose was friendly and professional. He got us our food and drinks with a smile... <br><br>The place was jam packed but it didn&#39;t take too long to get us in. <br><br>All in all this was a great dining experience, especially since I was super hungry!

To be honest I&#39;ve tried The Cheesecake Factory a few times many years ago. I&#39;m not sure why it&#39;s flown past my radar for this long. Probably because it was rather unremarkable. Well after another day at the Premium Outlets we decided to give it another try.<br><br>We ordered the Bacon-bacon cheeseburger, which as the name implies, is a bacon loaded burger stuffed with two kinds of cheeses. My wife had the Thai coconut-lime chicken (yes a a &#34;Thai&#34; dish at at American chain lol) which was actually quite good. Totally unauthentic but it seemed to work. Portions are big so plan accordingly if you came to eat the cheesecake. Most people will have a hard time eating a small appetizer, a full entree and then a cheesecake right after. We decided to opt for the to go option because we were seriously stuffed! (Red Velvet. Will report back)<br><br>If you&#39;re looking for a standard American style restaurant without comprise, Cheesecake Factory is a good option.
although i do feel the food maybe is over priced has great environment and great service <br>never had a bad experience

I have both but good things to say ...from the time we walked in until we left we were satisfied! The food was excellent! It came out fast and fresh, the drinks never disappoint. And Daniel our server was absolutely amazing!!! He made our experience wonderful!!!!
This Cheesecake Factory is always always always excellent. Great food, Great Service. <br>My friends and family had a outstanding experience tonight. Five thumbs ups .

We enjoyed a nice lunch at the Cheesecake Factory.  We had just finished shopping and wanted to eat something hearty and delicious.  As always, it takes about 30 minutes to 1 hour to look through the menu (exaggeration-LOL) because they have SO MANY OPTIONS!  They had something for everyone to eat.  I picked the spaghetti and meatballs off of the lunch menu.  Everything tasted SO GOOD.  The lunch portion is a great size.  Of course I had to order some cheesecake to go!  People, the cheesecake is outta this world!  I can&#39;t wait until my next Cheesecake Factory date!

If you want to get ripped off look no further.. I paid 21 dollars for a lemon shrimp pasta, that turned out to be half the food given in an11 dollar kids meal, the pasta was clumped in a ball, dried out and stuck together with a few pieces of shrimp floating in a sauce with diced tomatoes and stringy asparagus stems, not the edible tops... It tasted ok after I declumped the pasta. Our order was for pickup, no napkins or utensils were provided. My husband ordered chicken marsala, Wich was a bed of burnt pasta, with burnt mushrooms and a very thin chicken breast... the prices are rediculous, the food quality poor.

Cheesecake Factory is one of my favorite chain restaurants. When you go to a Cheesecake Factory in different cities, the food quality, menu, service, ambiance are standard. But wait, this location apparent does not adhere to the same standards. I was thinking maybe because they&#39;re at an outlet, they follow slightly sub par standards. <br><br>The food was just poorly executed and presented. We ordered calamari, Chicken Romano, Filet subbed mashed potatoes with sautéed spinach, chocolate cake, and a Chocolate Hazelnut Crunch Cheesecake.<br><br>They can&#39;t even slice the calamari before frying them. I had a whole squid mixed in with tentacles and rings. The noodles that came with the chicken Romano was not al dente - it was undercooked and chewy. I had to take it home and pour 1/4 cup of boiling water to bring the noodles to life. My sister got the filet and instead of mashed potatoes, she asked for sautéed spinach. She got about 8 leaves of uncooked spinach and the plating was just plain horrible. The chocolate cake and the cheesecake were good. However, they&#39;re 3/4 the size of what you&#39;d normally get at other locations. For the same price, you get less food and poor quality.<br><br>Service was just as bad. It was slow. We were given cold bread. He never checked on us to see if we needed anything or how the food was. I asked for a box for my cheesecake. I was still digging in with a fork and server was taking my plate from me! WTH? I&#39;m still eating and I can box my own stuff.

Food and cheesecake was delicious as always. I had the lunch carbonara special and it was really good and a good portion size. The fettuccine Alfredo is always rich and creamy. The chicken Marsala was fragrant and good too. This location was also very beautiful I loved the decor. I ordered the mango key Lime cheesecake and it was to die for . Service was very slow we waited forever, however our waitress had so many tables to attend and that probably was the reason.

I have been to this Cheesecake Factory and like other Cheesecake Factory the food and service is good. The low remarks for my review are based on the fact that they only do delivery through DoorDash. I ordered with a 30-45 minute window.  Over 1 hour 45 minute later still nothing. I know this isn&#39;t directly Cheesecake factory&#39;s fault but thy will not utilize better deliver service so it is their choice to use such a poor service. I will never order deliver from Cheesecake Factory again unless that utilize a better delivery service. So sad cause the food is so good.

Not sure what it is about The Cheesecake Factory where the service is consistently poor! <br><br>My husband and I both worked at the cheesecake (it&#39;s where we met!) for MANY years. The training was extensive and the expectations from our managers were high. If I provided service like the service we receive when we go, I would be fired. <br><br>Today was no exception. We went because we had a gift card. Even though the last few times (at other locations), the experience has been similar. Our server was slow, completely uninterested and lackadaisical. It started out semi fine, but turned into sitting and waiting for forever for everything with empty drinks. It&#39;s so weird to me to walk by a table over and over and see (or not see) that the drinks are completely empty and never think to refill. I&#39;m allllll for tipping and tipping well, but isn&#39;t that what I&#39;m tipping for?! To have a decent experience and be able to have a sip of water during the meal?! We looked around throughout our time there, and all of the server&#39;s tables needed their drinks filled, orders taken or food boxed up. But he was no where to be found. <br><br>We ordered the tuna poke entree. The presentation was beautiful as always. But the rice was dry (and wayyyyy too much of it), there was verryyyyyy little siracha aioli, and it was really bland over all. To give an example how bland- I shared it with my 9 month old baby. Especially for $15.95. I could get a delicious sushi burrito bowl with good quality fish and amazing toppings and fresh rice for $9 at a lot of places in Vegas now!<br><br>We also ordered the Shrimp with angel hair which was good and pasta cooked well and the crispy chicken costoletta. That was yummy too and came out with the side of sauce my husband had asked for. <br><br>We have such special memories of the Cheesecake Factory because of our history there.  We opened and worked in so many of the stores. It&#39;s such a disappointment to go and get such poor service when you know it&#39;s really not that hard and you can make good money when you provide a good experience. So we&#39;ve gone back for the history. But its the service that usually makes you walk out feeling like you just wasted your money and time :(

So we sat in the bar to save time waiting for a table and we were starving. Tiffanie was our waitress. She was on top of it all. <br><br>Ordered the farfalle with chicken, peas, etc... it had been awhile since I had that, so I went back to it.  Almost ate it all but didn&#39;t. Minus the non-uniform cuts of the carmelized onions, it was damn delicious.  <br><br>My mother ordered the chicken chili, which she thought was pretty tasty. <br><br>We ordered three slices of cheesecake... big mistake. Too much food.  <br><br>Lemon raspberry was not bad. Liked the mango key lime. But the favorite was key lime. Right amount of tartness.  Tiffanie was great because we were still shopping, she wrapped the cheesecake in a bag and then placed it in another bag with ice.

It was a nice surprise to find our favorite restaurant in Las Vegas Premium Outlet Mall, North.  This restaurant was no different from the other restaurants we visited except for the Waikiki location.  The reason being that the Waikiki restaurant is the Cheesecake Factory&#39;s busiest location.  This location had the great food, great service and of course, a wonderful selection of cheesecakes!  (Damn!  So much for my diet...). Stop by to visit if you&#39;re in the area!
Arrived at 6:55, 10min waiit outside for table for 6 Reservation at 7pm. But service was above average.

I ordered on line and got there when told by their message, sat in 100 degrees outside for an hour and finally left with no food! People have some common courtesy, you know it is hot, you know that you are WSY behind at least offer your patrons water and give us some idea when you think our order will cone out! You have ruined out Mother&#39;s Day and none of you showed any compassion for all of us waiting in the hot sun because you were behind, Shame on you; what poor customer service and shame for opening up without a plan for a special day like today!?i will NEVER COME back!

This is my first time coming to Cheesecake Factory. I understand things will be a little different now due to Covid &amp; I&#39;d have to expect delays. But I had made a reservation for 645pm, I arrived 10 minutes prior to &amp; was not seated till almost an hour later. I was very disappointed in that but the customer service with the waitress we had made up for some of it. Maybe if there is a way where The Cheesecake Factory can communicate through the app that our reservation would have not been ready on time, that would probably help to get a heads up.

This restaurant takes forever!  We were told that the wait was 15-20 mins.  Which ended up being 40 minutes.  We have now been waiting another 40 mins for our food.  This is unfortunate as we live a few blocks away and would come here often if there were not these issues.  It is not peak dining hours and they still cannot get it together!     <br><br>Update:<br>Your comment did not address the issue whatsoever.  Managing your wait times and getting food out of the kitchen quickly are the problems.  An hour and a half is not acceptable.   Then the server ran my card on the wrong check and gave my Amex platinum card to someone else.  Guest satisfaction equates to higher check averages.  Quick service means there are more checks to close. But you do not have to worry about any of that from me- me and my family will not be back.  When more people have the same experience I did, then you spend more money on marketing to being people in.  I hope you figure it out.

Im not sure why the rating is so low, but this cheesecake factory is top notch. It is located out on the fashion outlet shops off the 15 freeway, North, Charleston B. It is a high end restaurant that serves great quality food with excellent service, expect to be thrilled if you have never been here.<br><br> Outside, there are plenty of surrounding shops for people to shop for clothes, accessories and other various products. The location is located near a corner street. You cant miss it.<br><br> Inside, it is noisy during peak hours at about 3-6pm on a weekend. There are bathrooms located in the back and no free wifi. The decoration is like any other cheesecake factory: a yellow tinted wall with various ceiling lights. There is a cheesecake bar for people to order cheesecake at the entrance. There is a bar for alcoholic drinks as well. There are many booths and regular tables/chairs scattered all over. I have been here in the afternoon and at night. It is the same noisy environment.<br><br> Service: very good. Me and my family member were seated in less than 3 minutes. Our server was great, fast and efficient. He had a good personality and gave us our drinks before 3 minutes. Our meal came in about 10-15 minutes with a busy crowd. The bread they give you for convenience is warm. There are two types: sourdough and a whole grain bread. <br><br> The prices: pretty moderate. Most of the entrees on the menu are above $10 and can go up to around $50 for their more expensive specialty items. I personally enjoyed the chicken madeira. It is their most popular chicken dish. However, I order other items on their skinnylicious menu. It is worth a look if you are wanting to cut pounds. <br><br> Overall, it is a good experience. The food is worth what you pay for. The environment can be noisy, service is on point and the cheesecake selections are outstanding. Great for dates, family gatherings and hangouts with friends, but don&#39;t expect anything to be on the cheap end.
Always an overall nice experience. We made reservations on a Tuesday during happy hour and surprisingly it wasn&#39;t crowded. Our server was nice and the food was tasty as usual.
Great  experience, our server was very attentive to our needs ,the food was great and the desserts were awesome,<br>Food is priced appropriately

I love the food here but the service wasn&#39;t ideal for me. I thought it was the big party and wanted to let it slide but they had three people helping out and bringing stuff but they left and it still took longer to receive any service. I will stick to the other restaurants since this one the service wasn&#39;t anything to brag about. The only friendly person was the host at the front where we checked in. She was the only one who seemed to be happy to be there. Food is great, service eh

Probably the only time I was ever sad to be from Cali... only because this was hands down THE BEST service I&#39;ve ever received from any restaurant! <br><br>First off, the wait was only 5 min on black friday night! What a great start. <br><br>We then ordered two appetizers, the calamari and  avocado egg rolls. For the main course, my dad got the chipotle chicken pasta and replaced the chicken with shrimp, I got the usual steak Diane (medium rare) replacing the mashed potatoes with sweet potato fries and a side of chipotle aoili sauce, and my mom got shrimp tacos from the skinnylicious menu. All the food came out super fast and was scrumptious! <br><br>Our waiter was very attentive, understanding, quick, and kept up an amazing attitude the whole night. It&#39;s super rare to come across a server like this nowadays. We didn&#39;t quite catch her name, but she was a blonde woman. Happy holidays to her and ONLY HER!

I&#39;ve now been to this Cheesecake location 3 times and every time has gotten progressively worse. For a chain, you would think it&#39;s gonna be good... it just getting a server to our table took 10 minutes. After ordering, my water got refreshed occasionally.  Our order came out incorrect and my salad that I had ordered for lunch - never even came out. I told my husband over the phone that I had taken our daughter there for lunch and he said, &#34;really, I thought you weren&#39;t going to go there because they are so slow.&#34; Oops...
The time is long for the food<br>Came cold and not fresh at all<br>We were not happy with this<br>Well what can we do<br>Just go to different place
Always love dining at Cheesecake Factory!  Their list of menus are mostly my favorites, superb taste and nice presentation.  Thank you
Well out here in the Great Las Vegas, trying out the Cheese Cake Factory. Not bad... in fact very good. They are open if you would like to come in and eat. Just call before and make reservations.

Ok so I&#39;ve been to The Cheesecake Factory in three states and this location provided a decent experience. The wait for the food was extremely long but our party of four enjoyed our meals for the most part. I&#39;m a fan of the small plates and the crispy crab bites here were the smallest once&#39;s I&#39;ve seen. I guess everything really IS bigger in Texas, huh?<br><br>The fish and chips received rave reviews as did the chicken and biscuits. My mom really loved the gravy that came with it. The food itself gets four stars but I can&#39;t get over the wait time after ordering your food. That plays a big part especially if you&#39;re on a time crunch.

Some coworkers and I stopped at this location for lunch during the LVMarket trade show. Compared to the food vendors at the market it was much more reasonable in price and with a lot more options.<br><br>The wait was only about 5 minutes for a table and our sever was quick and friendly. As for food I had the guacamole salad with grilled shrimp added. The portion size was huge and the overall flavor was delicious. I&#39;d come back here again just for this salad.<br><br>Another typical chain restaurant, but with good service and decent food. A great lunch or dinner option if you&#39;re shopping at the outlet mall.
I love this place! I visited lunch time because long waiting at the dinner time. The carbonara and bread was so good as always!

The food was awesome and of course the menu of all the cheesecake made my day. I think that the lighting needs to improve because I felt like it was to intimate for a friend and family environment, very dark.

There was no parking any where. All the parking lots were closed or full and valet was closed. We waiting 20 minutes past our reservation time to be seated and when the food finally did come it was ice cold. I asked for it to be heated up and they told me they had to make it from scratch and that it would be 2 mins which turned out to be 15 minutes and by then my dinner partner was finished eating. The entire time we were there, the table right next to us was FaceTiming with someone on the phone on full volume while they screamed and yelled at an unreasonable level for any restaurant. It was so incredibly rude and they had no regard for anyone else eating at tables near them. I recommend you go to a different Cheesecake Factory. This was the worst experience I&#39;ve had at a Cheesecake Factory anywhere.

After a long day of shopping at the outlets, we stopped by for a late dinner. It was the only place that was still open with various food options. Regardless of which city I&#39;m in, the Cheesecake Factory seems to always have the same level of quality and service.<br><br>Our waiter quickly brought us water and bread and always made sure that our glasses/ basket was full. My problem is that I always load up on the bread and then I&#39;m never hungry for dinner. Oops! I shared my dish with my cousin, as their portions are extremely large. I forgot the name of the dish I ordered, but it was the pasta with mushrooms and chicken. I ended up swapping out the penne noodles of linguine to make it more personal. <br><br>After dinner we sat and talked for 30-ish minutes. It was nice to not be rushed out! <br><br>After a day at the outlets, I would recommend stopping by.

This was my first time ever to any cheesecake factory. I really enjoyed my meal and time together with my family. Our waitress was very patient as we had trouble deciding what we wanted after looking through the 18 page menu!!  Seriously the menu (I googled it) has over 270 items totally insane for trying to make a decision!! I had the lunch size portion of the Cobb salad my son had the monte cristo and my sister had the same as me. We split the coffee cheesecake which was so amazing. The coffee cheesecake had real coffee flavoring that was not bitter or over powering it was perfect.

Service and food was amazing!!! Our waitress was the sweetest! She was able to accommodate all 6 of my children, dad, and I  in a safe manner while still following governors orders. 2 separate parties 4 oldest teens together and 4 of us in another booth.

And so we reach the end of the line with another restaurant that I used to love but can&#39;t continue forward with because either a) The bean counters there have made them cheapen the ingredients and reduce the size of their dishes while continuing to raise their prices, b) The QA process is broken and they&#39;re putting out stuff that is so far away from what it was as they were on a successful upward trajectory, I can&#39;t accept what I&#39;m being served there, or c) the service sucks. It wasn&#39;t &#34;C&#34;, at least not at this location but it was absolutely both &#34;a&#34; and &#34;b&#34;. I ordered the orange chicken, a dish I&#39;ve eaten at multiple locations many times over the nearly 20 years I&#39;ve been eating at this place. It was just gross. I don&#39;t know if it was under-cooked or just had a lot of fat in it but whereas beef tastes a lot better with good marbling, chicken goes hard the other way. My wife ordered a burger which was also gross. I don&#39;t think either of us even finished our meals. I&#39;ve come to realize that this happens with nearly all chain restaurants at some point so I try not to get too attached. Either way, we&#39;re out. I didn&#39;t even bother to take a picture to spare anyone who is making meal plans from being icked out by what I had to endure
Ate a cockroach inside their cheesecake. Our whole family ate a contaminated cheesecake. Please take responsibility! Other review is posted on Facebook.

We came here for lunch and sat at a table in the bar area. Our server came over and took our drink orders rather promptly. <br><br>The menu is huge, so it took us a few minutes. And it doesn&#39;t have photos anymore so I was looking on my phone to get a better idea of what I was going to eat.<br><br>I ordered a lunch portion of the chicken, mango and avocado salad without wonton and skinny pomegranate dressing on the side. JD ordered the sandwich, soup and salad lunch combo.<br><br>My salad arrived and looked so sad. The chicken beast it&#39;s self was flat. It wasn&#39;t plump and juicy. It looked like it had been sitting in a freezer with a 100 lb weight on it. See photos. There was hardly any avocado- maybe 1/4 of one. No almonds to be found. The fruit was definitely not fresh. I was able to squish it so easily with a fork. It had been sitting in a can. You can always tell the difference between fresh, frozen and canned fruit. Nice try with trying to pull a fast one though.<br><br>When we told our server what was wrong, she made me feel that this was somehow my fault- as did the manager. I&#39;m sorry I didn&#39;t want crispy wontons on my salad and that I subbed dressings. It felt like that was what started this whole issue. <br><br>They comped the salad, we canceled the cheesecake slice we were going to share at the end of our meal because giving them more money after the way we were treated simply wasn&#39;t an option. <br><br>It&#39;s unfortunate that this is the first time I&#39;ve been to a Cheesecake Factory in about 6 years and that it went so poorly. Definitely reminds me why I generally stray away from chains like this. Maybe the one at Caesars is still better....

it was an extremely long wit for a seat here at lunch (it always is) but their food is large portioned, decently priced and classic american fare. My friends LOVE their pasta and were happy with their creamy choices while my chicken tacos were good, but not amazing. The avocado was brown and the shells broke with the amount of salsa they put at the BOTTOM of the tacos...<br><br>Service was also extremely slow and we were hardly attended to but the tiramisu cheesecake is probably my new favourite! Not too heavy, plenty of cake and coffee flavour too!

I love coming to Cheesecake Factory. Their menu has so many options. I always like getting the pesto pasta with deep fried eggplant. It&#39;s such a good combination! But I&#39;m really sad to say that they NO LONGER HAVE IT!!!  anyways I tried the Chicken Bellagio, it&#39;s really good the pasta sauce was pesto, Yum!<br>After my meal I usually order a cheesecake slice, my all time favorite is the lemon raspberry cheesecake!

Our experience at the Cheesecake Factory was a pleasant one. The ambiance of the restaurant is very warm and inviting. Our chicken taquitos came out hot, fresh and delicious. We also ordered a couple refreshing cocktails and the cheesecake was to die for. Troy, who served us, was so welcoming and caring. I will most definitely be back to this Cheesecake Factory to satisfy my appetite and my sweet tooth!

The Cheesecake Factory is always a safe bet!<br><br>The interior of this location was gorgeous. Maybe I was just in heaven because we had just seen Hamilton before going here for burgers, but I loved it! We sat at the bar and had a great meal. <br><br>The Old Fashioned Burger is charbroiled on a toasted brioche bun with lettuce, tomato, onion, pickles and mayonnaise. It&#39;s served with French Fries or Green Salad. It was perfectly cooked and juicy. <br><br>The Mushroom Burger is <br>charbroiled and topped with sautéed mushrooms, onions, melted Swiss, Fontina cheese and mayo. This one was overcooked (ordered Rare - got Med.) but still juicy and yummy. <br><br>We finished with an outstanding Lemoncello Cream Torte which had layers of  vanilla cake and lemon mascarpone cream topped with streusel and served with fresh strawberries and whipped cream. Wow! <br><br>4 Stars for ambiance and quality. Plus, the prices were reasonable and the service was great!

I rarely voice negative reviews unless the service is really bad, but I am livid right now. We ordered our special Mother&#39;s Day meal on Saturday to be picked up on Sunday at 2:30pm. I arrived promptly at 2:30pm with instructions to park in the garage and wait until a text was sent to let me know the order was ready. After 30 minutes, nothing. I called the restaurant and asked the status of the order. I see they are busy and am trying to be patient. The &#34;team member&#34; told me the order was being bagged up and I should receive a text shortly. I did not receive the text. After another 1 1/2 HOURS of waiting and trying to call the restaurant again, I decided to cancel the whole order and go home. I drove up to the restaurant and spoke with a woman who was directing  traffic. I told her I was told the order was ready at 3:00pm. She called on her radio to cancel my order. Someone quickly responded the order is ready. A woman came out with two bags. No apology, no thank you, no explanation. When I got home, the food was cold, fries were missing, and the chicken and steak were dry and overcooked. I never did receive a text. Needless to say,  my Mother&#39;s Day dinner was ruined. I will NEVER go to this location again. I have visited the restaurant in Summerlin with far better service.

This is an ultimate failure for a cheesecake factory. <br>When we arrive we didn&#39;t have to wait long, so that was pleasant.  Once they called my name to seat us knowing full well we have a small child and need a menu for him they didn&#39;t bring one. <br><br>They station us in a back area from the main dinning area. I didn&#39;t care so much about that, we did have to walk outside to go back inside to be seated.  <br>Once we are seated and given our menus I realize we didn&#39;t get a kids menu and I asked for one.  The hostess never brought us one so we ended up having to ask the waitress what was available for children. This was after we had already sat at the table 15 minutes before we were even greeted by our waitress; who was overwhelmed.   <br><br>We figure out what my son wants, we order drinks and food. We are asked if we want bread and we say yes. Then our waitress was off, we order water, sprite and a mojito.  We get our water and sprite about five minutes later and about fifteen minutes after that they bring my food and my husbands. I set timer and they bring my sons plate out, over five minutes later.  <br><br>When I was done with my meal they finally bring my mojito (mind you, after I ordered it I said I&#39;d walk back over and get it because it is pretty far from our seating area). They never did bring us bread and we never did see out waitress again because someone else brought our meals and drinks. <br><br>After we were done eating it took another fifteen minutes to get our check. <br><br>This was the most awful experience ever.  Poor time management and multitasking.  I think the manager needs some updated training.  He/she is way over their heads.  <br>Our food wasn&#39;t bad.
All went well I had a Southwest chicken sandwich <br>The waiter very professional we had a pleasant lunch.

Came here July 30 for the half price per slice NATIONAL CHEESECAKE DAY. Waited a long time to be seated. They told us 10-15 mins. Ended up being like 45 mins. Had to ask if our name was being called next only to find out they skipped over our name. The manager made us the next call after that was acknowledged. <br>We were seated. Our waitor was extremely busy. He was nice but not much customer service. We ordered tex mex egg rolls for appetizers. Pasta for entrees. And cheesecake for dessert. <br>Unfortunately both our pasta dishes were at maximum luke warm. The best part of the dinner was the appetizer and dessert.

We came in with a large party during prime dinner hours. Wait wasn&#39;t long at all. Our server was beyond attentive to the needs in my party. Drinks refilled continuously, suggestions for food, and just overall great service. The food was great, plus the cheesecakes were amazing. We took the remainder of our food to go and they boxed everything up for us very nicely.
More then an hour that I&#39;m waiting for my food ToGo !!! <br>After 1 hour I see that I asked no mushrooms and was mushrooms now I&#39;m waiting more 20 mins and nothing happened. Bad service

I&#39;ve been to plenty of Cheesecake Factories and they&#39;re all pretty similar - you know what you&#39;re gonna get.  This one was no exception.  Standard service, great bread, decent food.  Crusted chicken Romano is my favorite dish and I like that they serve a lunch size portion of it in the middle of the day.  It definitely hit the spot.  Convenient location at the outlet mall gives you a chance to sit and rest indoors and have something to eat before tackling more shopping!  It&#39;s really nice to have something other than fast food at an outlet mall.

Damn! It&#39;s dark!<br><br>My friend and I had dinner here the other night. Our waiter was good but the food was &#34;okay&#34; <br><br>I had the shepherds pie that needed a sprinkle of salt and some pepper and less grease. My friend had the fried honey truffle chicken. He said it was okay. <br><br>Last thing, i understand setting the ambiance but DAMN! Almost pitch black?! It was so dark. We had to take our phones out to read the menu. <br><br>I don&#39;t think I&#39;ll be coming back.

This location has totally redeemed my opinion of Cheesecake Factory. Not only did I have wonderful friendly service but the food quality was absolutely devine. <br><br>For lunch I had an appetizer of avocado eggrolls (10/10 crunchy, savory and fresh) and for lunch a club sandwich with a side salad (10/10 absolutely perfect)<br><br>Really enjoyed the food and experience and can&#39;t wait to be back!

What a horrible experience on Mother&#39;s Day. Waited 2 hours in the car waiting for a text message to say my order was ready. Never received at tex. Had to go and hunt for my order at their restaurant door with all the other ppl waiting as well over an hour. They were the worst.
Went there with wife on Valentine&#39;s Day ordered food only got one meal he never ordered the other one then ordered a beer never came bad service

After a nice long day of shopping for things I probably didn&#39;t need, this place never seems to fail. This was actually my first time at this location but I kind of knew that the food was going to be great because I used to be a regular in the location in Hawaii. <br>What I&#39;ve never had before was the Korean fried cauliflower.. are you kidding me?! That dish was amazing! The cauliflower itself was not over or under cooked, and the flavor is not over powering like how some places make it.. it was so pleasant to eat.... I ordered another one -_-...dont judge me-<br>Their veggie burgers have always been pretty good in my opinion for as long as I have been eating them.<br>The customer service and attention that we have received was perfect.. cheesecake factory is doing something right.
The food is good as usual. <br>Service was great. <br>The only thing I noticed is that the portion of my chicken medeira was small haha<br>That Georgia peach drink was amazing though!

We had to wait 3 different times before the staff could figure how to seat 7 guests (4 adults, 3 young adults). The parking garage had about 6 prime spots reserved just for Cheesecake Factory Management. Our server never asked too  refill our drinks. The speed and accuracy of our food was excellent, though. You do get your money&#39;s worth.

After a solid afternoon of shopping, I was hungry! I love CF&#39;s spicy chicken sandwich, unfortunately not this time :/.  I was in a group of 4, 2 of us orders the chicken sandwich, and our server brought out 2 of the 4 entrees.  She mentioned that they were waiting for fries to cook.  A while later, our chicken sandwiches were brought out to us. I noticed that the ketchup looked solid and the ranch had a greenish color.  We were so hungry so we dug in.  The chicken was dried out. You could tell that the plate was sitting under the heat lamp while the fries were cooking. Eventually our server asked us about our food and I let her know I couldn&#39;t eat the sandwich.  She took my plate and the manager came to check on us.  They took the chicken sandwiches off the bill and offered to provide something else or a cheesecake.  We declined but were very appreciative of the way things were handled.
I come here often when shopping the north outlets in Vegas. Good food at a good price. It is consistent.

HORRIBLE HORRIBLE HOREIBLE HORRIBLE WARNING!!! the wings were supposed to<br>Be buffalo they were completely dry and tasted like pure salt. Prior to us coming into this place we looked at the menu online and already had a set idea of what we wanted upon our arrival they had only 2 of the 10+ appetizers on there menu and we never made it to the Main course. Our waitress ROBYN was amazing and deserves a f@&amp;$ RAISE for the stuff she has to deal with here the manager was nice enough to refund us our money but overall experience NEVER GOING BACK

Been here twice and both time I was upset, the first time the chilaqueles were not cooked throughly, they had no bread ready at all and the second time the nachos were burnt. Other wise the services was good but had no soap in the bathroom.

I will NEVER go to this location as long as it&#39;s in existence!!! My sister and I frequent this location a lot! At least once or twice a month and have never had an issue until tonight!!!! <br><br>My sister arrived earlier than me and decided to to score a booth in the bar area where the hostess came and shooed her out of the booth. The hostess then proceeds to advise her that she was only allowed to sit at the bar in order to participate in happy hour even though none of the booths were occupied. I was very confused because we have sat in booths in the bar area several time and never encountered an issue. <br><br>Finally I arrive and wanted to speak to a manager because it didn&#39;t seem right and inconsistent. Well here comes Sam....whom was extremely rude to us. He wasn&#39;t interested in anything we had to say and accused us of complaining. I told him we weren&#39;t complaining and was just curious of the inconsistency and I really didn&#39;t want to sit at the bar in order to be able to order off of the happy hour menu. He then tells us to go to another restaurant like Brio so my sister then tells him &#34;it feels as if you don&#39;t want us here, like you&#39;re trying to get to get rid of us!&#34; He continued to be rid so ultimately we left and found our new favorite spot Wolf Gang Puck in Summerlin. <br><br>I called to corporate office the next day and spoke with a gentleman who took down my concern and contact information and I waited a month and still no response. I ended up calling corporate again where they issued me $20 eGift card which I ended up using at the San Francisco CCF. I will not be going back to the CCF. I don&#39;t like how they handle customers or their concerns.

My girlfriends and I came here for a late night dinner and drinks. We waited about 15 minutes (even though we called ahead and they said they had no wait) and were sat in a booth in the back by the door. Our server was nice, we didn&#39;t see her too much of the evening but we didn&#39;t need much. The food took at least 30-45 minutes to arrive. She forgot to put our appetizer in, so once we got our meals they comped our appetizer and brought it late; which we ended up splitting it to-go. The food was good, of course. I think the prices are way too high for what this place offers, obviously not the location&#39;s fault but the brand itself. Was a nice restaurant, small and a little compact with strange restrooms but it was overall just fine.

I had a gift card as well as coupon for a free slice of Cheesecake as Christmas gifts, so decided to finally use them. The restaurant was fairly busy even in the middle of the afternoon, but I was seated immediately (easy when you are a party of one). The interior was semi-upscale and clean, like most Cheesecake Factory locations.<br><br>I originally was greeted by a female waitress who said she would be right with me, but then I ended up being waited on by a young male waiter instead. He was very friendly, but it was clear that he was very new and probably in training. For some reason, he removed my set of utensils and napkins, so I had to ask for a new knife to spread butter when my bread basket came. The bread was fairly tasty: warm and two varieties.<br><br>I ended up ordering the eggroll sampler as well as the avocado toast. Both dishes were good, though the avocado spread on the toast was a bit tart. I was actually pretty stuffed after finishing both dishes, so had to take my strawberry cheesecake slice to-go to eat later.<br><br>My water was inconsistently refilled, and it took A LONG time for my check to come, and even longer for the bill to come back after I gave my credit card and gift card/coupon. <br><br>Though the service during this meal was a bit below average, the food was still decent and I would consider this a solid Cheescake Factory.

Never disappointed with whatever I order. The service was great and the food was on point. We ordered the grilled steak tacos and the honey truffle chicken. They were both delicious. If you like a bit of spice, the tacos are for you. We subbed the rice and Beans for loaded mash potato. Yum. The honey truffle chicken was sweet and the chicken has a nice crisp to it. <br>Service was fast and friendly. We didn&#39;t need to ask for anything.

We got married and I showed the cheesecake factory to go eat dinner after the ceremony the waiter was amazinghe even spoke Spanish because my husband and my brother-in-law don&#39;t speak English and that was really awesome that we had somebody in the table they could communicate in English and Spanish we loved everything the cheesecakes we got were very big and we loved the waiter he was super ...we will be coming back

We started our day at the North Las Vegas Premium Outlet and I saved my stomach just for this. We arrived around 12:48 PM and we were led to a table right away. It wasn&#39;t extremely busy but most tables were occupied. I ordered a hot cafe mocha, spicy chicken chipotle pasta (lunch special), and a white chocolate raspberry truffle. We were also served with complimentary breadsticks. They were warm and were great to munch on before our meal. <br><br>The cafe mocha was large but nothing too spectacular regarding the flavour. It was a standard mocha. The spicy chicken chipotle pasta smelled delicious when it arrived. I also added some Parmesan cheese on top. The crispy tortilla chips added an extra crunch to the dish and I enjoyed it. The spicy chicken was flavourful, and had a nice kick. There were also pieces of asparagus and green peas to add a little green to the dish. However, I thought the pasta itself were too firm, it would have been better if they were softer. <br><br>I took a long time to decide which cheesecake to get because they just had so many! After much contemplation, I settled for the white chocolate raspberry truffle cheesecake. It was a big slice with whipped cream on top and on the side. It was truly delightful, it wasn&#39;t too sweet which I liked. At first I was worried that it would be too sweet but not at all. The cheesecake itself was smooth and creamy, with a great balance between the white chocolate and raspberry. I cannot wait to try their other cheesecake next time I&#39;m in the States.<br><br>Service was great, the server dropped by to check up on us and made sure everything was good. Food arrived in a timely manner. I asked for a to-go cup for my mocha and I received one promptly. Overall, I had a great experience at the Cheesecake Factory.

First time coming to this specific location, and I love that is down the street from my house. We went to celebrate my mothers birthday, tried to call ahead to make reservations but they do not take any. Thankfully it was not busy and our party of 9 got seated right away. Our server was great, but I honestly cannot remember his name :( He was asian, wore glasses and I think his name could have been Han or something like that. <br><br>Food was good, everyone order something different. <br>I had their combination plate with my favorite thing ever, herb crusted salmon. Came with a creamy lemon sauce, asparagus and mashed potatoes. For the second thing I got their steak diane. I forgot how it tasted and I was craving mushrooms so decided to get it. Let&#39;s just say that I did not enjoy it, as I thought I would. <br>We had some buffalo chicken strips that were really good. <br>And my boyfriend had their jambalaya with shrimp, sausage and not sure what else but it was tasty. Packed with a lot of flavor. Only downfall was that they had ran out of white rice, so they gave him brown rice. <br>For dessert we had the red velvet cheesecake....eh I do not like red velvet so I am not even going to review this dessert. All I can say is, it was a huge slice. <br><br>As we were finishing dinner, they brought out a little ice cream sundae for my mom, as they sang Happy Birthday. Over all everyone had a great experience.

Good place to eat I love the food here. The Tex mex egg rolls and the spicy chicken chipotle pasta yummy ... I had a reservation at 7:30 pm and they had the table exactly at 7:30 ready for me and my husband. I was just a little be disappointed with my drink I order a coconut Mojito and it was to much mint that I couldn&#39;t taste the coconut or the rum.
I came here on a Sunday at 10 am. I ordered the jambalaya hash gluten free. The potatoes were amazing and the spice was just right. Service was attentive.

Made me sick in middle of the night. Paid $40 via Door Dash. The salad was fine but hardly any feta cheese on the Greek Salad. The worst was the Cheeseburger Spring rolls! Toooo greasy! (Doesn&#39;t that happen when you fry in oil that is not hot enough?). Never again. Since I don&#39;t know which of my 3 items really did make me sick, I had to toss out what was left (a lot!) of the entire order.

Been there many many times and the service was so great more than it was bad! If you have the option of having Daniel as your server jump on it! He&#39;s so amazing very helpful and offers great conversation and excellent advice on food and drinks. WE LOVE DANIEL!!!
The service here is fanominal! The food was great and the atmosphere is typical big middle class restaurant. I&#39;d recommend it.

3 stars because everytime i come back i pray they put the FIRECRACKER SALMON back on the menu and i get disappointed every time. I just come for the Miso Salmon with extra glaze and mashed potatoes instead if rice.

From the moment we got there it was terrible. Asked the hostess if there was a wait time which she lied and said &#34;no&#34; and there was a wait. Then we waited what we thought was 15 minutes but turns out by our check in time per the managers (Skylar) words &#34;23 minutes&#34; for a waiter to come and acknowledge us. (The couple behind us noticed my boyfriend talked to the manager and confirmed that they also waited a very long time to get acknowledged) We ordered 2 drinks, mine came out but my boyfriends did not. It must have gotten lost because he was parched without a drink for about 10 more minutes until we made our waitress aware of the &#34;mistake.&#34; After all that we spent an hour and 10 minutes for 2 drinks and one shared meal. I will never recommend or spend my money at Cheesecake Factory again. <br><br>P.S. We live closer to the Summerlin location but weeks ago they served us undercooked food so we decided to try this location instead. Our mistake, because they still failed at decent service.

My sister bought a cheesecake at this location for a family birthday and my girlfriend felt a crunch and spat out a cockroach from the cheesecake. Threw up. The roach was cooked into the cake. We immediately stopped eating, knowing that we all ate a roach contaminated cake. There were 2 children who also ate it. The next day, we reached out to the Southern Nevada Health Department to do a full investigation on the property. After reaching out to a local exterminator, they confirmed that it is a roach. After contacting the management, we reached out to corporate because he mentioned that the cake was baked elsewhere and not in the property. When we went in to the restaurant with the contaminated cake and roach to hopefully receive at least a refund, he said he cannot reimburse us and he did not take responsibility for the matter, only bringing corporate&#39;s faulty. He did not offer a sincere apology, refund, or offered any suggestions, nor accept the cake. Disappointed. How would you feel if your family ate a roach inside a celebration cake?

Always a 5 star experience no matter which one we go to.<br><br>On a Friday night before Christmas it was a bit busy and we did have to wait over an hour which is longer then usual. <br><br>The server was very friendly and helpful for our large party.  The menu is huge but everything I order I end up loving.  THe fish and chips were so crispy and juicy! Th fish tacos had so much flavor.<br><br>I try a new cheesecake every time and this time it was the Hershey Chocolate one. Wow! A mouthful of chocolate in all its forms and cheesecake! I was in heaven!

Would never think but they have some of the best burgers ever!!! The menu is insane and there is something for everyone, i seem to always get a burger. I just tried the celebration cheesecake and I craved it for days after, yes that good....

Disappointed visit. We usually love this location but today the service was terrible. We ordered a mojito that was super flat, let the waitress know, and she brought us another one. That one didn&#39;t taste any different so the manager came over. He said I just tested the club soda and it&#39;s fine. Um, how do you test it out and are you going to offer something else? Nope, we were wrong and still had to pay for the mojito. Waitress never brought our bread, I had to ask for it. Just an overall bad experience.

If I could give negative stars, I would. It started it off by having 6:45pm reservations for 2 plus a 2 month old baby. We arrive at the restaurant and got an ear full from the front worker because the reservation wasn&#39;t made for 3, I&#39;m sorry I didn&#39;t know a 2 month old would be eating dinner from the restaurant. We didn&#39;t get seated until 7:15. The lady who sat us also made a big deal about our stroller and asked if she could take it to park or somewhere else. Ummm what. And then our waiter didn&#39;t bother to even come up and take our drink orders because my friend started to feed her child. Which by the way she was completely covered. Two other tables got seated after us and he took their orders first. We finally placed or order at 7:40. I ordered a to go order for my husband to have when he got home from work. That order came out at 8:15. Our food didn&#39;t come out until 8:36!!! Our food came out cold! Ice cold! And then we asked for a manager and she said she would cover our meal and asked if we would like her to &#34;heat up&#34; our food. Like how gross!! Needless to say we left the restaurant and will not return.

I got the sweet corn tamale my favorite appetizer.  It was so much thicker and the green sauce was not plentiful.<br><br>The Cesar salad was okay but the crouton was yummy yum yum.<br><br>Service was average.  Wait time ok a weekday<br>At 3:00 was fifteen minutes.

Located in the North Premium Outlet mall, having been given a gift card, we decided to stop here after shopping and wanting a drink.<br><br>We didn&#39;t order food and sat at the bar. But then again, once you&#39;ve eaten at one Cheesecake Factory, you&#39;ve eaten at them all. <br><br>The lovely bartender took and made our drink orders straight away. We ordered a passion fruit mojito and a Long Island Ice Tea. Total with tip came to be about $25.<br><br>The mojito was deliciously served in a tall Pilsner glass. The fresh mint leaves was a refreshing treat. The LIIT was also good, with a heavy pour, but then again it&#39;s a LIIT.

Came down to enjoy Cheesecake Factory mainly because of the Avacado Eggrolls  I originally walked up to the bar because I&#39;m aware there&#39;s no wait. I tried to sit with the bartender and he just was closed off and no personality and had attitude when I asked if there was an amount on the gift cards I had. So I walked away from the bar to grab a table. <br>I got sat and I was restarting my meal. My waitress was Nicole and she was so so sweet. She advised me her honest opinions on one of these features drinks and I was not let down. I ordered the eggrolls unsure if I wanted a meal. I ordered the sausage and shrimp pasta which was good; however a little heavy creamy wise on the sauce. She delightfully packed me up my red velvet cheesecake and I was on my way. <br>Thanks girl and thanks CKF.

Was able to snag a seat at the bar even though I wasn&#39;t there to drink.  It allowed me to skip the 5-10min wait time.  The place was packed at 3:30pm on a Monday!  The bartender was helpful picking between two meals I couldn&#39;t decide on.  Her description of the Chicken Madiera was so precise!  Their sourdough bread was warm and fresh.  Their passion iced tea was refreshing and didn&#39;t have any indication of mold in their<br>dispenser!  Yay!  Trust me, it happens.  My food came in about 10min from when I ordered and was delish!!  The bartender checked on me a few times... just enough... not too much as to be annoying.  Bathrooms were clean and well enough away from the eating area.

I like going here for lunch. They offer many varieties and have a lot of selections for lunch specials. As big as their menu is, all the dishes I&#39;ve ordered here end up tasting good. I almost always have enough leftover for dinner too. For the price and the portion you get, it&#39;s a good value. Service is decent. They can be a bit slow when they&#39;re super busy and being in the outlet, they&#39;re usually busy. However, I&#39;ve never had major problems with the service. If you don&#39;t want to wait to be seated, you can seat yourself in the bar area as those seatings are on a first come first serve basis. Love their wheat bread and they will gladly give you extra if you ask. My favorite dish here is their miso salmon. They also offer great happy hour. Definitely worth checking out when you&#39;re in the area!

I took my mother here for her birthday and it was great. The wait wasn&#39;t bad and the food was delicious. The price was better than I thought it would be. I really enjoyed this place. It&#39;s family and friends friendly.

Charmaine was our sever for that night and she kicked ass! Great service and attitude! Super patient with us (some of us are a little slow) on taking our order! Will be coming back because of her outstanding guest service! The food was brought out at a perfect time, overall great experience! Thank you! Much love!

BIG fan of the Cheesecake Factory franchise ever since I&#39;ve tasted their Red Velvet Cheesecake. This was my first visiting this location of The Cheesecake Factory.  We checked in at the front desk and the lady said the wait time will be 5-10 mins and got seated at 8 mins. Kinda nice knowing we were seated within the allotted time because we know TCF gets extremely busy.<br><br>We started off with  &#34;Warm Crab And Artichoke Dip&#34; due to &#34;Fire Roasted Fresh Artichoke&#34; not being available which is kinda disappointing, we really wanted to try it and &#34;Stuffed Mushrooms&#34; which is really good, kinda sad they only serve a small portion of it because it&#39;s my favorite. <br><br>For entree, our party ordered the &#34;Pasta Da Vinci&#34; &#34;Fresh Grilled Salmon&#34; &#34;Herb Crusted Fillet Of Salmon&#34;. What I like about TCF over the larger restaurant chains the food never lets you down. The food portions are always large to share with others. <br><br>Leave some room for desserts though. As we didn&#39;t so we ordered for takeout. No matter what you are craving when it comes to cheesecakes you will not go wrong. I recommend the red velvet and the salted caramel. Oh boy what a surprise because I thought nothing could top the Red Velvet.<br><br>The customer service was super slow, our server hardly dropped by to fill up our water. But I sorta understand seeing how busy the place was. So we didn&#39;t think too much of it.

Never had a problem with cheesecake factory they all been consistent in the same let me tell you they have many different styles of cheesecake and always are very good my favorite dish on the menu is a salmon moist sweet and flaky if you&#39;re ever around a cheesecake factory stop by and get yourself a bite to eat if you&#39;re not hungry just grab a cheesecake

Ok, mostly I&#39;m upset because maybe I&#39;m dumb but I thought that &#34;Shrimp Scampi&#34; meant noodles, shrimp, and cream sauce. But I ordered a Factory Combo for $22.95 which I thought was a great deal for the Herb Crusted Salmon, Mashed Potatoes, and a Shrimp Scampi... the kind with the noodles. This should have been called &#34;Breaded Shrimp and Cream Sauce.&#34; <br><br>Anyways the mashed potatoes were good but I wanted gravy. The Herb Crusted Salmon was alright. I didn&#39;t really like the crust, a bit too bitter for my taste. The breaded shrimp was good and the cream sauce was fine. I really hated the sauce that came underneath my salmon and asparagus, I&#39;m so very glad that they put the asparagus between my salmon and the sauce so that it wasn&#39;t already touching and I was able to save it. I love asparagus and mine were ruined. :(<br><br>My boyfriend ordered the Mushroom Swiss Burger, it was fine. He asked for it to be cooked medium rare and it was quite well done. <br><br>We ordered Chicken Samosas for our appetizer and I thought the cilantro dipping sauce was quite wonderful. I thought the samosas were pretty good.<br><br>The star of the show was... <br><br>The complimentary wheat bread!! Omg. It was soooo amazing. It was so warm, nice and toasty... it melted in my mouth, no butter neeeded. It was sweet and just so so amazing. I ate one whole piece and half of the second piece. I wanted to eat it all but of course I had to share, lol and I didn&#39;t want to ruin my appetite!<br><br>Of cooourse we had to order a cheesecake since we were at The CHEESECAKE Factory! There were so many to choose from I wanted to try em all but we both only had enough room in our bellies to only share one! <br><br>After a long time of trying to decide we chose the Turtle Pecan Cheesecake, it had a yummy brownie crust but not enough pecans. We took off the big chocolate mousse thing, it was better without it.<br><br>We needed to check out Cheesecake Factory since everyone loves this place but we just weren&#39;t really big fans! The food was just mediocre at best and the service was slooooow.
One of my fave chain happy hours in Vegas. A fan of the chicken sandwich, sliders, nachos and egg rolls. Go mojo to for light or Long Island for boozy. Always ask for the bread.

On a week long vacation in Vegas. Yes we have TCF at home and I love it! I had the herb crusted salmon for the first time - ordered the lunch portion. It was excellent! Another in my party had the crusted chicken Romano.  Plate filled with pasta and a chicken piece that would cover the &#34;palm&#34; of your hand. Very disappointing.
