No problem with the other two meals. Lost our original server before out meal was served. Another came out and said she had to go home because of a migraine. He was very good!

My wife and I absolutely love The food here and we visit quite often! The service is amazing even tho it gets packed. I have tried almost all of the special entrees and have not found one that is not good. I recommend The Cheesecake Factory for birthdays and dinners with friends.

Whoever thought of putting a sit down restaurant in a shopping outlet is a genius! Sometimes we just need a break from all the fast food even when we&#39;re on the go (but don&#39;t get me wrong I love me some Panda Express still). <br><br>This location is just like every other ones I&#39;ve been to, which isn&#39;t a bad thing! It wouldn&#39;t be Cheesecake Factory if it wasn&#39;t big in size, portion, and in choices. Even the lunch portion size fills you right up! The taste is always on point and consistent so you never have to worry. <br><br>Their service is always great! From the moment we walked in, we were constantly handled with so much care. The only thing is that our food took 20 minutes to come out. But our server Jessica made sure to check up on us and apologized for the wait!<br><br>If you&#39;re going to be shopping off the calories, doesn&#39;t that mean this place is worth the visit?

Tried this location for my first Cheesecake  visit while in Vegas. Sat @ hi tops in bar area,drinks came out slow,Zaire did the food. 2 of us had taco mealss,spices were way to hot. Afraid I won&#39;t be back.

Cheesecake Factory at all locations is never a disappointment. Large portions and the food is always great. Even if you&#39;re not that hungry....appetizers is the way to go. Pork Belly Sliders, Warm Crab and Artichoke Dip and Sweet CornTamales just melts in your mouth. Reason prices for the large portion of food that you get. Great energy and vibe in the restaurant as well.

We normally enjoy coming to Cheesesteak Factory. Today not so much.<br>The music was way to loud making it difficult to converse without almost yelling. Brenda our waitress asked us to repeat ourselves several times.<br>My wife enjoys the macaroni burger. They were out of macaroni. So she had to get another option.<br>I ordered the cheesesteak sandwich that was so so. It reminded me of pressed meat and really didn&#39;t have much flavor. Unfortuanately the roll was pretty hard. I asked for a side of au jus so I can dunk my sandwich. It came in a gravy boat making it difficult to dunk.<br>But the fries were really good!
Superb food <br>Their cheese always taste amazing <br>And cheesecake never let me down<br>One less star for the service is soooo slow!!

I haven&#39;t ate at a cheesecake in a very long time. <br><br>It was a little confusing because the entrance that&#39;s located in the shopping area of the outlets mall is at the back of the restaurant so you have to walk through the restaurant to get to the hostess stand. Honestly I never liked that because its weird. Anyways, just an opinion..so as we got to the hostess only for us to tell us its going to be 15-20 min. Odd to us because since we walked through the restaurant we saw it was completely empty so 15-20 min? Ok...<br><br>We were sat after about 10 min and we were greeted by one server who said she would give us a few minutes after taking out drink order.  A couple minutes later another server comes up and greets us and asks if we would like some bread, we say sure. The first server comes back with our drinks and starts to take our order. The second server comes back with our bread, sees the server taking our order, says to her she can do it and then......they proceed to argue about who&#39;s table it is. Uhhhh??? So needless to say that was interesting. <br><br>So moving on we place our oder, get our food and the food was pretty good. I had the ahi tuna salad which was extremely tasty and very fresh. We also ordered a burger which was huge! The food saved this experience for us.

Been waiting a while for our food. I&#39;m assuming the beverage I ordered is never going to materialize so I&#39;m just seeming that a lost cause at this point. Lotta standing around by the start for how not busy they are

Review #099 - 2017<br><br>My friend and I were walking around the outlet and got hungry in the middle of our shopping trip so we decided to head over to the Cheesecake Factory for a quick lunch.  We showed up around 1:30 PM for lunch and were seated within 5 minutes.  <br><br>I felt really terrible because we were walking for quite a while before my friend told me that she was starving.  I&#39;m such a bad friend!<br><br>Our waitress came to greet us and brought us some iced water.  We ordered an appetizer and one item each and decided to share everything.<br><br>I wanted to try the truffle-bacon grilled cheese sticks as our appetizer, and I am so glad that it turned out to be really good or else I would&#39;ve been really disappointed since my friend told me to choose.<br><br>She ordered the shrimp with angel hair pasta and asked if she could have a side of salad, but I told her that I was going to order the factory chopped salad and she could just share some of mine.  Good thing we decided to share everything because their portions are no joke.  We enjoyed everything we ordered.<br><br>Service was pleasant and our food arrived in a timely manner.  Our only complaint was that the air conditioner was probably set to 40 degrees or something since it was 90+ degrees out and the temperature difference was so drastic that it made it hard to enjoy the environment.

I&#39;ve never been a fan of Cheesecake Factory because I feel like their food is mediocre and overpriced. That being said, this newly opened restaurant at the Las Vegas North Premium Outlets is a welcome addition. Dining options at the outlets have always been severely limited and kind of atrocious. It&#39;s nice to have a sit-down option instead of eating at the food court. <br><br>PRO TIP: Make sure to enter through the front entrance near the street, otherwise you&#39;ll walk in on the side like we did and be confused as to where the hostess stand is located. <br><br>COMPLIMENTARY BREAD: Served with softened butter that spread easily on the bread. Love when that happens. 4/5<br><br>FRIED ZUCCHINI ($4.95): Served with a side of ranch. Came with maybe 8 pieces of zucchini. Delicious. 4/5<br><br>LOUISIANA CHICKEN PASTA ($16.95): Our waiter said this dish was very popular. My husband and I split this dish and ordered the chicken on the side. More than enough food for two people! I don&#39;t understand how they serve this huge bowl of pasta to one individual. Unfortunately, the dish wasn&#39;t as spicy as I would have liked and could have used a bigger helping of veggies. 2/5 <br><br>SERVICE: Waiter was great. He was super cool about accommodating a picky vegetarian eater (me). Hostess was super friendly and we were sat at a booth on a Monday night with no wait time. 4/5  <br><br>VIBE: Modern cafe with a tan and brown color palette. Very family friendly. 3/5 <br><br>GOOD TO KNOW: If you fill out the feedback survey on your receipt, you get a $10 e-gift card good on your next visit. :)<br><br>Worth a Return Visit?<br>Subtotal was about $27 for one entree and one small appetizer. Prices add up quickly here. We ate here because we were starving and didn&#39;t have a lot of dining options available to us. I wouldn&#39;t go out of my way to eat here, only as a last resort kind of thing.<br><br>YELP 100 CHALLENGE 2015: #227

We&#39;ve been to this CF twice already,  both times for Sunday Brunch. If you read the rest of the reviews here, lots of people have issues regarding service. I get that this is a new location and it takes time to work out the kinks, but people just gotta take a chill pill!!!<br><br>Our first visit, we split the Chicken Chilaquiles and the Lemon Ricotta Pancakes, both were excellent,and the food came out in a timely matter. Our server couldn&#39;t answer a few questions about a few of the menu items we had, but no big deal..everything else was good.<br><br>This recent visit over EDC weekend, once again, we went for the Lemon Ricotta Pancakes and this time we ordered the Chorizo Chicken Hash with Poached Eggs.<br>We noticed however that our waitress seemed preoccupied and didn&#39;t seem happy. We had a few questions about things and  got short answers. We knew something was up. Now at this point, people  would dock a star or two regarding service,  but upon returning, Wifey asked politely &#34;Having a rough day?&#34;<br><br>Our waitress stepped back with a big sigh and apologized explaining the start of her day with a huge  power outage, EDC traffic, getting the kids ready, and getting ready for work all at the same time, so finding this out, we kinda sympathized with her and assured her that the worst part of her day was over, and whaddayouknow? Her demeanor did a 180...some people just need some positive reinforcement ya know?  Drinks were refilled, checked up on us periodically, and even the manager came by and was apologetic when she saw our food hadn&#39;t arrived yet!? We didn&#39;t feel  like it was a long wait, probably because I was engaged in conversation with my hot date across me...; )<br><br>When our food did arrive, the Lemon Ricotta Pancakes were bomb as always, and The Chorizo Chicken Hash was perfection. From the perfectly oozing poached egg (lots of places have a hard time doing this) to the extra crispy hash I requested, no complaints here! Call me loco, but I prefer the  Cheesecake Factory over some of the other breakfast /brunch spots in town! ALOHA!!!<br><br>Shaka Meter: \uuu/  \uuu/  \uuu/  \uuu/  4

I&#39;ve been to Cheesecake Factory with larger parties before but yesterday was the biggest disappointment. I came to Cheesecake with a party of 12. First off, I have to say our waiter was the nicest, but he was very very slow. I&#39;m not sure if he was new, but if that&#39;s the case then he gets a pass. <br><br>He came around 2-3 times asking what our drinks were. About 20 minutes later he came back and asked for our orders. Once our orders were taken, it wouldn&#39;t be until another hour until we received our orders. And for me and my boyfriend, another HALF HOUR-45 minutes until we got our orange chicken and chipotle pasta. In total, our party got their food within an hour and we got our order about an hour and a half later-two hours later. By that point, we had 3 sprites, two baskets of bread, our buffalo blasters, and we were not hungry anymore. We took our food to go because our party was already done eating.<br><br>I do have to say about 2 or 3 managers came out apologizing saying our orders are coming out hot and fresh. Yes, I accept your apologies, but it doesn&#39;t change the fact that you guys didn&#39;t even take at least the appetizer off the bill and we still paid full price. My boyfriend and I waited 2 hours just to take our food to go. I&#39;m extremely disappointed in Cheesecake, specifically this location.

This was the first time I have ever visited a Cheesecake Factory, and they set the bar for me and my future visits. <br><br>The Cheesecake Factory has a large selection of items on the menu, as well as a large selection of cheesecakes to choose from for dessert. Anything that you may feel to be in the mood for, they will have it from pastas, to burgers, to steaks. My personal favorite is the Hibachi Steak and I have many favorites for cheesecake, especially the Oreo cheesecake. You honestly can&#39;t go wrong eating at the Cheesecake Factory, and this location in the Premium Outlets North is generally pretty dead at night, especially after the mall closes, so it&#39;s the perfect place to eat at with a big group, or your date.

Shorted me on my chicken, sauce was nasty. $22 for this, extra $5 for tiny ass pieces of chicken. Had to go searching for our waiter, never check on us. On top of that they took almost 40 minutes to bring my plate out even when it&#39;s just pasta and my friends had order salmon and got their plate 15 minutes before mine. They took it back and said they&#39;ll make me another dish but at that point my appetite is ruined then they took another 30 minutes until I decided to cancel. Ridiculous. Trash.

The food is great, no complain with that. The service crew is so helpful. This should be a 5 stars but we left our thermos and never got it back. Call the next morning, there is no thermos at the lost in found.

So, I placed an order online for curbside pickup, with a scheduled pickup time.  I ordered curbside bc I just didn&#39;t want to go into the establishment: 1. Bc I wasn&#39;t dressed for it, and 2. Bc of the pandemic and just not being comfortable yet with going into restaurants, especially where there are a lot of out-of-town visitors. Anyway, my husband and I arrived at the restaurant at the scheduled time, but there was apparently no curbside deliveries going on today.  I eventually went into the restaurant, only to have it be confirmed that there was no curbside pickup bc the phone lines were down. That explained why I was only getting a busy tone the many times that I called. Needless to say, I ended up having to go inside and wait in line to pick up my orders. I&#39;m not sure if it was the sunglasses that I totally forgot that I still had on, but somehow a worker whom I&#39;m assuming was the manager noticed me. Feeling a bit put out, I explained to her what had happened.  She was VERY apologetic.  To make up for it, she offered me a free slice of cheesecake, which I turned down at first bc the whole thing was understandable and forgivable.  However, at her insistence I accepted her offer.  She even added the slice of cheesecake to my order and brought it around the bakery counter to me so that I wouldn&#39;t have to wait any longer.  Wow. I didn&#39;t get her name, but she&#39;ll know that it&#39;s her that I&#39;m talking about when and if she reads this.  To her I say Thank you!
Evette is such an amazing  server! Such an efficient and fast worker. Always smiling and definitely on her A game! Thank you Evette for the awesome and fun dinner experience!

I thought it was pretty neat that there&#39;s a Cheesecake Factory at the North Premium Outlets. After a long day of shopping, a good meal is always a great idea.<br><br>I ordered the BBQ Ranch Chicken Salad &amp; it was good. The serving was huge &amp; it was tasty.<br><br>My party of 17 was seated in the extended seating section. The area is more private, less busy, not as noisy, more windows, &amp; the lighting was brighter. It was great to be seated there, but we were also forgotten by our server. After ordering our meals, she didn&#39;t come back to check up on us &amp; we had to call another server to get her attention a couple times (or even requested for items from a different server since that seemed quicker). <br><br>Despite this, the food was good, their free bread is delicious, &amp; the ambiance was like all the other Cheesecake Factory chain.

This is about the closest restaurant to my workplace yet I was worried it would be too hectic for me to enjoy it! <br>I had to go for Half Price Cheesecake days, and I arrived shortly after opening. To my surprise, there was no one sitting at the bar. I had the new salted caramel cheesecake which is quite delightful! It has a blonde brownie bottom and I love cheesecake that is a combo even more! <br>They really should do the half price deal more often than once a year! <br>This place is sparkly new &amp; clean and I hope to return to check out the happy hour!

This is nestled in the outlet mall. The menu is pretty standard and the service was actually not up-to-par with some of my other Cheesecake Factory visits in Southern California.<br><br>Their &#34;patio&#34; is actually an indoor patio area- which I think is smart.<br><br>Parking is whatever the outlet mall has to offer (which may get busy on some days).<br><br>This place was a-ok.

The hostess was polite and sat us in the amount of time she allotted for our wait. The service was attentive, not personal, but we received our food as ordered and in a reasonable time. The portions of food were good except for my order of the seared ahi. For $20 I got a bunch of rice that was closer to hard than soft and four slivers of tuna that belonged on an appetizer platter or with a salad. I was highly disappointed in my meal, still hungry and everyone else&#39;s leftovers. My sister and son shared fettuccine alfredo with shrimp that was yummy and my cousin ordered a chicken tender dish that was probably the whole damn chicken. I was the only one that got the short end of the stick but everything else was good.

Poor service.  I was led to a table in the bar area and I had two children with me .   The girl got an attitude when I asked to be seated somewhere else . Appetizer brought out cold. Waiter really could benefit from learning some customer service skills.   Not worth the price.

I can&#39;t allow myself to give a billion dollar franchise a 5 star rating, so they&#39;ll get a 4 from me. It&#39;s not like they&#39;ll lose stocks or customers over it.<br><br>Anyway, when this location opened up in the North Premium Outlets, I thought, &#34;this is going to be dangerous.&#34; I literally work about 300 ft. away, so I knew that I was going to have to practice self-control. I&#39;ve placed my lunch order for pick-up here a few times now and it&#39;s been nothing but awesome.<br><br>Every time I call, the ladies on the other line are friendly. At the pick-up counter with all the chaos of other orders, the cashiers are fast and friendly. I haven&#39;t had any of my orders screwed up, so kudos to them, especially with my lunch being timed.<br><br>As for the food, everyone knows their menu is vast. If you&#39;re eating healthy or don&#39;t give a crap about heart disease, they have something for everyone. They can even alter some items to be gluten free. Portions are huge, so you can always split your meal into 2 servings. And of course, who can forget their infamous delicious cheesecakes? Oreo, lemon merengue, vanilla bean, plain, etc. The list goes on for about a page and a half on the menu. Hence, where the self-control comes into play.<br> <br>I&#39;m a fan and I&#39;ll definitely be back when I &#34;forget&#34; to pack my lunch:)

I was a 1st timer here at Cheesecake Factory... Boy was i glad we made decision to come here. 15 min wait not a big deal I&#39;m sure it&#39;s been longer. When seated waitress very polite i don&#39;t remember her name though. Takes drink orders &amp; was on top of our refills for the sodas. Also i guess we get complimentary bread which was delicious. Now appetizers i ordered the macNcheese balls in marinara which was excellent. My bro had taquitos which he said were hot lol... Main course bro had chicken parm sandwich looked big came with fries. He said was good. I had meatloaf came with garlic glazed corn or something mashed potatoes &amp; mushroom gravy All delicious!!! Definitely will be back for more. Was too full next time will try dessert.

If you&#39;re not counting calories and you&#39;re hungry, swing on by to The Cheesecake Factory. Super cute and spacious restaurant located in the Premium Outlet Mall. The restaurant is very comfortable and is the perfect spot to catch up with your friends, stop by when you get hungry from all the shopping, or when you are craving a piece of cheesecake. They serve anything from fish and seafood, to salads, to sandwiches, to pastas! I always order the Louisiana Chicken Pasta when I&#39;m here and I&#39;ve been doing that for the past several years. You can&#39;t go wrong. They also have a skinny menu if you&#39;re trying to be healthy. Cheesecakes here are also a must. Save your tummy for a slice or take one home with you!

We decided to load up on the carbs before a big (shopping mall) run.   Everything we had was up to par for what Cheesecake Factory is known for:  good pasta and great cheesecake.<br><br>My wife and I split a chicken piccata with angel hair pasta.   The dinner portion was enough to feed us both.  The lemony sauce mixed with the capers brought a nice zest to the buttery noodles and the tender chicken  provided our delicious protein requirements.  This is our go-to dish for Italian and it&#39;s done pretty well here.<br><br>The side of little crab cake bites and ahi tuna tartare we also ordered were fairly good as well.  As was the marinara bow-tie pasta my daughter ordered.<br><br>Dessert was great.  One giant Fresh Strawberry cheesecake to feed two adults and two small kids.  <br><br>Service was fairly prompt, only slow once when awaiting for our check.   Prices were reasonable and by far this is one of the better options for dinner around the outlet mall.

Good food, busy restaurant, not quiet. <br><br>Servers are always attentive and knowledgable. The menu has a huge selection. Almost too huge! Food is always great. Portions are big and I usually have leftovers for the next day&#39;s lunch.<br><br>Sometimes it can be quite noisy and tough to have a conversation. There are so many tables next to each other that noise can really travel.<br><br>This is one of my wife&#39;s favorite places and I always get in trouble if I go without her.

Food was ok not all that great and when I went to the restroom it was small and dirty and it smells .. so I&#39;m checking in and checking Out !! For this to be apart of GrandLux they really could do better !!

Cheesecake was about the only good part of this experience.  I ordered lasagna and was told they were out.  Picked chicken parm pizza style and was told that that was also out.  they made me something different which was not great.  our waiter was boring and had no personality. since they were out of my 2 first choices i asked him what kind of cheesecake they had so i did not order something that was out and was greeted with a blank stare. This was the second bad cheesecake experience in 2 different cities so we will not return.
After a long day of shopping this place just saved my life, its hot as heck here in vegas so stay hydrated, as always the food is amazing, never disappoints!
My husband and I come in for happy hour often because they have great food and drink options for around $6 if you come between 4pm and 6pm.
Beet with avocado- amazing, fried cheese- amazing, pasta Alfredo for kids - just perfect. Very tasty. Nice place and nice staff

The food is good, but I always leave disappointed because they never have the slice of cake I want.  The service was eh, because water was not refilled when empty and the server was hard to track down.  I still can&#39;t get over the fact that I&#39;ve been here multiple times and never get the slice of cake I want because it&#39;s either out or still frozen.

The food was delicious. Service was good! But very loud music so nobody could really talk to each other or even listen to any conversations. Very long wait, not ready for large groups.  very Chaotic environment, but could have been the night I was there. Still a good diner to eat at!

Yum! Cheesecake Factory never disappoints! Besides having the best cheesecake in the planet they also have an amazing happy hour. We tried the sweet corn tamales (my favorite thing), pork belly sliders, and crab and artichoke dip. Everything was SO good and HUGE portions for super cheap happy hour deals. I also had a spiked lemonade cocktail. It was clean, good service, and no wait which was great considering how busy they were.

We are currently on our second bread order, and just got offered a third order because we&#39;ve been waiting for 50 minutes for our food. It&#39;s just our section of the restaurant because other sections are getting served faster than ours. Everyone is complaining. This is horrible guys, what kind of restaurant etiquette is this. Our drinks have been refilled 4 times. And only one of our guest one of our guest for their appe

Love this restaurant! Think of a restaurant that has a little bit of everything to please every member of your party, and ending the night with a delicious slice of cheesecake. They also have amazing free bread they give out as well. This location is located in the north outlet mall. If you can find where the street &#34;symphony&#34; is at the mall, that is where the restaurant is located. Parking garage is located right across the street and parking is FREE! Woohoo. Great place for a date night or any kind of meal. They have a huge menu offering a lot of different stuff, and a huge cheesecake menu!
I had the steak tacos and my cohort had the fish tacos.  Both were amazing!!!! I always try a deferent cheesecake so this time I chose the tirimasu cheesecake... meh there&#39;s better options.

In Nov I had to choose a location to have dinner with my employees. We chose this place since we are a big fan of cheese cakes. I mean who isn&#39;t right? So I called and the manager at the time said they don&#39;t normally take reservations but she would enter us in for a party of 16. A  few weeks passed and I called to confirm our reservation for Dec 18th. The person over the phone said they would be ready for us at 8. The day of our dinner I have employees show up at 7.48pm and the host lets them know they don&#39;t do reservations. My employees call me since I was running a little late and they said they wouldn&#39;t seat them. After 3x of explaining to the host she finally opens a book (were they keep reservations ) and noticed they had a reservation for us. I finally arrived and spoke with the manager in which he did apologize and said we would be seated in 30 minutes. After waiting till almost 9 we were finally seated and it postponed our meeting so much. The host in the front who seats you seemed like we were just a bother the whole time. She came across really rude and thigh the manager seemed apologetic, there was nothing offered or done to show some sort of customer service appreciation. Once we sat down the waiter was good and the food tasted great. I am really disappointed on how their expectation of customer service at the front. As we were leaving one of my employees decided to order an extra cheese cake and they said &#34;next time order with your waiter because they get commission.&#34; I can honestly say there may not be a next time. Thought their food is great, their service needs a lot of work<br><br>( I added another star since the owner reached out and apologized. Thank you for caring !)

This location is located where my wife and I were outlet shopping.  Very convenient, spacious, and well decorated.  They have an extensive menu and the service is great.  We shared a bbq chicken salad and a combo entrée with chicken and beef.  We were so stuffed that we couldn&#39;t order any cheesecake.  We did however, look at cheesecake showcase to dream about it.  Next time, as from previous experiences, this is what they are known for.

Jasmine was our server and she is awesome! We were a party of 8 and she was quick to take our drink and food orders. She is friendly and a great server! All of the food was delicious. This restaurant is clean and comfortable. Great atmosphere. We came to this location to be away from the strip but the restaurant was still busy. We waited about 45 minutes to get a table but there are places nearby to pass the time. It was worth the wait! Highly recommended!!

On November 30th I went and ordered the fried chicken sandwich. The lighting was so dim I didn&#39;t notice that the chicken was burnt. A few bites in I peeled back the bread and realized it was indeed pretty overdone. A handful of the fries were also so overdone and I could hit them against the plate to hear an audible noise with the fry not even breaking. When I brought attention to the food I still had to pay for it and instead got a free slice of cheesecake. In my opinion that&#39;s not fair because I paid $13 for the sandwich and got a slice of $8 cheesecake? To me that doesn&#39;t make sense nor does it make me want to come back.

Service was subpar to say the least,  they ran out of bread and my husband&#39;s food was burnt, which unfortunately we didn&#39;t notice until we got home! This is the third time I&#39;ve had a horrible experience at this location....DEFINITELY won&#39;t be back

The Cheesecake Factory offered an inviting lunch venue today.  A full sun, morning in July with a temperature of 108°F already, can leave a shopping clan of adults and children weary, parched and irritable. <br><br>Upon our entry, the service was cheerful, immediate, and helpful. Our table service from James was hospitable and accurate. The Kids&#39; Menu was varied. The proportions were generous. My son opted for grilled salmon, sauteed carrots and French Fries. My daughter&#39;s plate had crispy, moist chicken tenders fresh fruit and also French Fries. The chicken was surprisingly lightly battered rather than a dense mass.<br><br>Thank you Cheesecake Factory for a family friendly day in Las Vegas. A 5 star day for me is a menu with lots of organic options.

I remember makin&#39; my way Downtown (sorta) when this Cheesecake Factory opened. I wasn&#39;t impressed. They messed up my order and the Mac and cheese was not up to par with the one at Caesar&#39;s. I didn&#39;t have high expectations for my return, but what can I say, it&#39;s the mediocre yet deliciously free bread that keeps me coming back. <br><br>I brought a friend to share a plate with me. She had her doubts about sharing since she was starving, but I know my way around a Cheesecake Factory. We ordered the chicken costoletta and swapped out the side of veggies with a side of mac and cheese. If you haven&#39;t tried the mac and cheese at CF, do so immediately, it might restore your faith in them. The serving size was huge, of course, and we were unbutton-the-pants full. It was awesome. I had plans to buy a cheesecake slice, but we were meeting up with our friends and I didn&#39;t want any vultures stealing my cheesecake, you know how it is. Our server was very nice and very knowledgeable, I wish I had gotten her name. <br><br>Only downside of this trip: host said 10-15 minute wait and we waited over 30. We almost left, but that mac and cheese was calling my name. Have I mentioned the mac and cheese yet? <br><br>... mac and cheese.

tldr<br><br>We go to this location often and it&#39;s always pretty busy but the staff is very attentive and consistent with following up.<br><br>Got:<br>-orange chicken: I usually can&#39;t finish this entire dish because of how big the serving is! Come with a small medley of carrots and string beans with a strong zesty orange flavor throughout.<br><br>Protip: don&#39;t go so hard on the bread basket, the entree portions are very generous and filling.

Always, no matter what Cheesecake Factory I go, FABULOUS!  If you like crowds, it&#39;s not for you. I love the noise, atmosphere, the energy of the place, people, bartenders, all of it. Today&#39;s food was great. Happy Hour Menu, Buffalo Blast- Excellent &amp; Artichoke Spinach Dip-Excellent!

Always such a delight and delicious place to eat. There&#39;s such a great variety every one gets what they want. And who doesn&#39;t love $10 Cheesecakes lol I wish they were less I&#39;d buy more. Maybe if they had buy one get ones during the week more people would come.

It&#39;s a bit busy despite the fact that it is a big restaurant. We were here for lunch and ordered the miso salmon and breakfast burrito. The wheat bread that we received was very delicious and it&#39;s worth a try! The food took a bit but they offered banana slides for our toddler which was very helpful to keep his attention! Our waitress Stefani was very friendly and gave us a honest option when it came to order the food which I really appreciated! She was attentive and took great care of us! The food was flavorful and the portions are big! The cheesecakes are great too specially the caramel one! I&#39;d definitely eat here again! The only issue I would point out but it&#39;s not worth deduction a star was that the bathrooms were out of order (family bathroom and one of the women&#39;s bathroom). However, after pointing it out they immediately tried to fix it - great service!!

Cheesecake Factory seemed to be the perfect place to meet others for lunch.  It&#39;s located in the North Vegas Outlet Mall,  We were early so ordered the quesadilla as an appetizer.  That should have been our lunch.  The appetizer shared by two was delicious and there was a lot of it.  We had expected the hot jalapeno peppers to be on the side but they weren&#39;t.  We had to dig them out.  The lunch caesar&#39;s salad was delicious but also huge.<br><br>The air conditioner kept it very cold .. probably perfect for workers but not for guests.  <br><br>Server was okay, not great.  We had to remind her about items a couple times.

Burnt appetizers. 45 minutes wait for 3 dishes which came out wrong, at different times so we could not eat together. Thirsty. Rude manager who made us pay for food that had to be remade. Free cheesecake offered for our horrible experience. Will never come to this location.

When you&#39;re shopping and you&#39;re starving...Cheesecake Factory saves the day. The food is the same at all CF locations. What made this location special was the employees. The hostess let me know where there was an outlet to charge my phone. Our server D was so sweet and we had great conversation!  She&#39;s from our hometown! Lastly Martise W. (Sorry if I butchered the spelling) gave us info on the best way to get to our AirBnB. Thank you all!

M&#39;kay, so, like - I&#39;m probably one of only five other people on the PLANET who&#39;d never been to a Cheesecake Factory.  Why?  Dunno - just haven&#39;t, sue me.  Well, this location is in the Vegas Premium outlet center and after losing my mind in Michael Kors and other stores, it was time to eat and get out before I had to get a 2nd mortgage on my house to support my shopping habit.  <br><br>Anyhoo - the atmosphere is nice, decor is great - the low marks I give this are for the 1) service and 2) regular food.  I have been to the sister spot, Grand Lux and GL seems to be better to me.  As far as service, our waiter was SLOW and had attitude.  It took forever to just get water, he forgot to bring bread to our table and when I told him one of the things I wanted was for to-go he got snippy with a &#39;you should have said that first&#39; - UM, excuse me?  Anyway, the salad I ordered to eat there was over chopped - that may be weird to say but I like to see whole leaves in my salad - this one was over chopped like shredded lettuce in the store.  But it tasted good.  My friend ordered these buffalo chicken tenders that for some reason had the buffalo sauce on the inside - nah - I gotta skip that in the future, that&#39;s just not right to do to chicken. <br><br>BUT - the Turkey burger is BAE!!!  That tasty somenother gave me LIFE!!!!!  The caramelized onions on it are the thing dreams and rainbows are made of...... mind you I ate this later on in the day in my hotel room after several rounds of drinks but trust me, my taste buds know good burgers even if they are reheated. <br><br>There is location near my house and I intend on stopping in to grab some cheesecake (the one thing I did NOT do on this visit) - so we&#39;ll see if I feel better about them then.  Otherwise, pass for me, I&#39;ll Grand Lux it out.

Our server was great but ALL of our food came out cold, we ordered 2 appetizers and 2 entrees and had to send 1 app and 1 entree back to be heated up. I&#39;m taking room temp food..... we ordered the spinach dip and it tasted frozen, not a lot of flavor.... but my samon was good and again the service is great

Busy place<br>I like coming here...the service is always great<br>My wife will come back here after shopping at  Saks...I love unwinding in this place<br>My favorite meal -bistro shrimp ...followed by espresso and red velvet cheesecake...

I forgot how big the portions are at this establishment lol it makes sense since the dishes can be a tad bit pricey. I have the Louisiana chicken pasta and it was okay nothing mind blowing ,kinda don&#39;t understand what makes it Louisiana ,but it was good either way. The salads look amazing here! The service here was great our waiter was very nice. I was here for a dinner party so there were about 30 of us and the staff handled it very well. The variety of foods to choose from was huge but that&#39;s what the cheese cake factory is known for. But to wrap it up I was impressed with the staff and I enjoyed my dinner. Good job guys.

The food here is really good, the desserts are amazing! We went with the chocolate truffle layer cake and it was crazy good. The wait time for a table was only about 5 minutes and the wait staff is super nice and friendly.
Gosh the Miso Salmon is Extremely great!!! Don&#39;t forget about the Extreme Oreo Cheesecake too!!! Totally had a great time here.

omg love this place!! server charmaine was amazing . came in for my sisters bday and was handled with great care and  wasnt let down at all. hunnid percent recommend this place , but exclusively with server charmaine . cool and laid back vibe, great service. -
Best pork chop I&#39;ve had in a while! Great service as well, overall a perfect night out with the family.

One thing to rely on when visiting chains, food tastes the same. Always get my usual and a nice cheesecake to finish. What makes this one any different? Customer service! He was very patient with my kiddos. Even after a spill, he was still all smiles and very attentive to our requests. Menu choices: chicken madeira, crusted chicken Romano, pasta carbonara, pumpkin swirl cheesecake. All great!!

Here&#39;s a simple transaction gone stupidly wrong.<br><br>A man walks into a Cheesecake Factory 30-minutes to close. The place is less than half full, so it&#39;s not busy by any measure. All this man wants is to order two slices and to go home. He stands in front of the display case, as one does, waiting to ask a question and to then place an order. <br><br>And he keeps standing there. <br><br>There&#39;s one busy bee who&#39;s pulling all the weight filling orders as the dupes roll in. She&#39;s far too preoccupied, that is clear. Then there&#39;s the other, standing at the register, pretending to be busy. She looks at me on occasion, we make eye contact, and it&#39;s clear, I need help, and she&#39;s not busy, nor is she coming over. Maybe it&#39;s not her job? Maybe she&#39;s been scolded for leaving her register? I don&#39;t know. It&#39;s not my job to know.<br><br>I wait a few more minutes watching the hustle. One manager comes in and gives the busy bee an understanding kiss on the head. Odd. Neither here nor there, though. I eventually walk over to the one whose feet are stuck at the register. She asks if I need anything. Incredulous, I say yes, and a question, but is there a reason you didn&#39;t come over when you saw me standing there forever? <br><br>&#34;I was busy.&#34;<br><br>No. No you weren&#39;t. And your muscles could have transported you over three feet to meet a customer. Anyway, I place my order, and there&#39;s not an ounce of hospitality in her voice or actions. No civility. Cold dismissiveness. I thank her for taking my money, but she continues to stand there. My cheesecake? No. She eyeballs the guy standing beside me, then back at me. Am I supposed to interpret this eyeballing? She then snarks at me to move, that, &#34;I need to take his order.&#34;  <br>&#34;THAT&#39;s interesting,&#34; I say. She has to take *his* before completing mine, after I&#39;ve been standing there for ten minutes already. And how does that rule work if the line is more than two customers deep? <br>Have I wronged this woman somehow, in a past life perhaps? Just unreal. It&#39;s like she was stickin&#39; it to me. For what? For being a customer? <br><br>While waiting for the next guy to place an infinitely long order before receiving mine, I see another manager come by. I tell HIM what just happened. He apologizes, which is nice, and he collects my cheesecake and hands it to me. Apologizes again. All that&#39;s well and good...but what are you going to do about that staffer (Sharonte, the receipt claims)? Let her look at me smugly as I leave, which she did, and let bygones be bygones? <br><br>Bad service is bad service, happens from time to time. But this felt weirdly personal, and as if no one cared whatsoever. Looking at other negative reviews, there&#39;s an obvious pattern here, as well as the textbook response from Management. Maybe try fixing your service issues instead of endlessly apologizing for them? <br>This Cheesecake is less than a mile from my house, but there&#39;s no way I&#39;ll ever return, not with that welcoming and sendoff as if I&#39;d been punished for some unknown transgression. <br><br>Cheesecake splurge mood: spoiled. Rotten.

Date &amp; Time:  Monday December 19, 2016 @ 1pm<br>Location:  Premium Outlets<br>Dining Companion:  Mommy<br>Scene:  Shoppers in Burberry Scarves &amp; Tall Boots<br>Decor:  Small &amp; Large Booths<br>Service:  Fast, Friendly, Efficient<br>Devour:  Breakfast &amp; Kale Salad<br>Total:  $23

It was so nice to be able to sit down and enjoy a meal in between outlet shopping. I believe the prices are the same here and the portions are large as usual. They also have many lunch specials available here but they definitely aren&#39;t cheap. We got the lunch size bistro shrimp pasta and the Asian lettuce tacos, which were both delicious. They also have a skinny menu with lower calorie dishes available. Most of their cheesecakes are amazing and large enough to share, just depends what flavor you&#39;re in the mood for. Service was a bit slow since we went during lunch time, so I wouldn&#39;t recommend coming if you were in a rush.

Absolutely TERRIBLE! The prices for the food are outrageous and the food is so bad. We were without service for 45 minutes and when we did get service the waitress was rude and never came to our table, it took 20 minutes to get refills on drinks. We ended up being there for 3 hours and it was awful. Almost got to the point of us getting up and leaving. She overcharged us for several things as well, we didn&#39;t end up correcting her because we wanted to pay the $150 bill and leave. An example is she charged us 4.90 for a kids bowl of strawberries that is 2.95. Very upset and do not recommend, much better places to go in Las Vegas don&#39;t waste your time here.

My favorite spot in Vegas!  Calamari is always crispy fried to perfection and I&#39;m usually pleased with the entrees... tonight I had chicken piccata...amazing just needs to be a little more gregarious with the lemon.,.i like to taste a bit more lemony flavor but other than that, the delicately sautéed chicken with mushrooms and capers really complimented the angel hair pasta.  And yes, Cheesecake me please...that is ultimate red velvet cheesecake!  Yum

Great food, Great people! My pasta carbonara was just a lil but oily, but the mushrooms were so tasty! Steak was ewwwwk! The bread was freshly made. The wait for the food is not too bad, just expect it since the location is at the outlet so it&#39;s busy. Overall the experience was good!

So we hit up Cheesecake Factory since we were in town for the Olympia, and my friend Branka had competed for the first time in the most prestigious bodybuilding event in the world and was starving for cheesecake.  Branka and I got four cheesecakes in total: Chocolate Tuxedo Cream, Ultimate Red Velvet, Original and a Kahlua Cocoa Coffee cheesecake.  I had the Kahlua one and it was so rich I couldn&#39;t finish it!<br><br>Our waiter was fantastic too - Shawn R and was pleasant, on top of things and really friendly.  Definitely was a good way to cap an intense weekend!

Second time I tried The Cheesecake Factory and this particular location wasn&#39;t that bad. I thought it would be busy since it was at an Outlet. We waited for about 5mins before we were seated. The server was very nice and attentive, place was clean and the food was delicious.

Took 25 minutes to get simple appetizers ( 2 house salads, and mac and cheese)<br>Waitress super rude and had no knowledge of menu. <br>Food comes out 3 minutes after the appetizers were finally brought and tasted as if they had been under the warming light for 20 minutes . Never coming here again.

We came here to celebrate my nieces birthday huge mistake! We arrived at 845 and we&#39;re seated pretty quickly for a party of 10, it wasn&#39;t that busy. That&#39;s where the best part ends. It took about 15 min for the waiter Nate to get to our table to even ask for our drink order. Another 10 min pass before our order is taken and 10 min later he returns to inform one of our guests they are out of fried zucchini.... ok no problem.<br><br>Now 30 min pass and waiter informs a guest that they are out of steak... WTH.. At this point we are getting pretty hungry and you know they bring all food out together sooo further delay. An hour has passed and I get up go to the front and ask for a manager. Manager Rob appears and I explain we have been waiting an hour and the 30 min delay in finding out they were out of steak. He tells me that the order hadn&#39;t been back there long as if I were lying, I was literally pissed! He proceeded to say he would look into it. <br><br>I see him in the kitchen area talking to his staff and after another 15min some of the food starts appearing. Crazy part mine appeared last.  Some birthday celebration I lost my appetite.      Needless to say I will never return. Maybe smaller parties have better luck but this service was horrible.

Best waiter ever! Montice provided impeccable service, with a couple of laughs on the side. He was an expert on the menu, and gave us his honest opinion on the items we asked about. We&#39;ll definitely be visiting again soon!

UPDATE:<br><br>Last time we came here we didn&#39;t have the best experience. But we came back to this Cheesecake Factory to give it another try. We received the best service hands down from Robbie, The guy with the  man bun, blue glasses and big ol beard. At first he came by our table handed us some waters and bread and walked away and didn&#39;t say anything. We were like oh no, here we go again. Then he came back and offered to get us some drinks and such. Honestly, he&#39;s not your typical server, but it&#39;s what made us like him so much. He&#39;s not super bubbly and chatty and fake like half of the servers you get. He seems very genuine and thats what made us like him so much. Definitely will be back. <br><br>Robbie is awesome!!! <br><br>***<br><br>This was literally my first bad experience at the Cheesecake Factory EVER! Normally me and my fiancé come and have a great experience, great food, and overall great service. This time we didn&#39;t get to experience any of that. <br><br>This was our first time at this particular location. But since we come here so often, we already know what we want to eat. And this time we were on a slight time crunch, wanted to be in and out in an hour. We got sat on the patio, on a Wednesday afternoon. It was a pretty slow section. There were only 3 or 4 tables. So when the server first greeted us, we immediately ordered our food when we ordered our drinks. That was at 2:30, so 15 minutes goes by and our server accidentally takes a fall and hurts herself, breaking glasses and such. She went to the back to get iced up I believe. With all the servers they had all day, you&#39;d think they&#39;d get someone to cover her section. But all we really got was a walk by from a manager asking if we were ok. 35 minutes goes by. And we still don&#39;t have our food. Our waitress was back out on the floor. <br><br>At that point I just wanted to walk out, but we did order drinks and still had to pay for them. And my fiancé was starving, so we asked to get our food Togo. 45 minutes later, we get our food Togo. I asked to get our delicious strawberry lemonade Togo, and they gave us a tiny kids cup filled with ice to go with our meal.<br><br>As we walked out, I told the manager that stopped by our table earlier that our service was terrible, and all he had to say was that he was unaware of it. We understand our server did get hurt but that doesn&#39;t make up for the terrible service. Especially since there&#39;s 20+ servers working on the floor at the time. We don&#39;t eat at Cheesecake to eat takeout, we choose to eat at Cheesecake for the experience, and this Cheesecake Factory restaurant completely failed us.
Nice meal , service could be better, but they were very short in staff, no busser around, cant get same more bread, food come out fast!! We have to wait 15 min for a table, but is ok.

I want to take a minute to thank Bryant Darren for his excellent customer service. It was a special dinner with my family for the last day of the year. I talked to his manager and I told him but I want that when you guys go to cheecake factory you can request for Bryant service. Working in the food industry is not easy and need more employees like Bryant with his excellent customer service once again Thanks Bryant.

Worst location I&#39;ve ever been to in Las Vegas it&#39;s safe to say i will not be returning. The wait staff is terrible most of them and they just leave you sitting without checking up on you or seeing how everything is. The host staff just sits on their phones and side eye customers. The food quality was not exactly up to par. This location has a lot of revamping to do especially with the choice of staff

Generally when you go to chain restaurants, you expect the same delivery in taste and experience on the whole. Unfortunately this location did not.<br><br>My boyfriend and I went after a lovely show at the Smith Center and it let out about 10pm. We wanted to go eat somewhere nice and conveniently close. As we love our Cheesecake Factory at Green Valley Ranch, we decided to try this location based on our great experiences with the other locations.<br><br>Great factor was that it was open till 12am but downside is that even though there were not so many people on a Friday night, the service was very slow. We usually get our favorites, Avocado Spring Rolls, Bistro Shrimp Pasta and Rib Eye Steak. <br><br>The Spring rolls were delicious as is the sauce which is easily devoured! But the Bistro Shrimp pasta was really spicy! Now this is supposed to be a general garlic and wine sauce with no spicyiness at all. It had way too much red chili peppers! My mouth was on fire! <br><br>The steak was burned but my boyfriend ate it anyways since he was hungry.<br><br>When the server asked about the meals I let him know of the issues but all we got was a &#39;Sorry&#39; (It wasn&#39;t his fault for the food though) and only 5% off the bill.<br><br>If you want the traditional Cheesecake Factory yumminess, don&#39;t go to this location as it lacks the quality and taste.

I was so excited about the expansion of the Premium Outlets/North, and was even more so, when I heard that this major restaurant was joining the newest shopping wing. Good timing, too. We had a couple gift cards to use. <br><br>So, we came here on saturday for lunch, way before the crowd; since we got a tip from one of the ladies here to get in here before 12:15 pm as we were checking out the menu posted outside. <br><br>We had the complimentary bread basket  with butter (french baguette slices and pumpernickel slices) and our little man had one too, which also included sliced bananas. I had a bunch of questions about the menu, since it&#39;d been a while. I opted for the lunch size asian salad, while hubby had his favorite item, the cuban sandwich, and our little man had the mini corndogs and fries. It was delicious. I couldn&#39;t finish my salad, which was pretty big, even for the lunch size, but I&#39;m glad I asked about the size of the salad. We also got dessert, once I mentioned the crazy one, hubby wanted that one. It was really good, too. I just was stuffed. (We had leftovers.) We still had a balance on one of the gift cards. They are treated as credit cards, so you still have to sign them. <br><br>The service was excellent- our server was pretty attentive (drink refills, and checking on us from time to time). And the other servers were nice and smiling, as they passed us, too. It&#39;s refreshing to see people in customer service who want to be there, who enjoy their jobs.   <br><br>Inside, the decor (barqoue/neo-classical- elegant), was very in line with their other restaurants (been to Forum/Summerlin/Green Valley). We had to switch seats (booth &amp; tables seating is available) as the TV had hubby&#39;s game that he was DVR&#39;ing. Our stoller was stored with the rest, elsewhere. The lady gave us a claim ticket. <br><br>Bathrooms were near the entrance. There were mens, womens, and a family one. I went into the womens and there were two stalls, one was handicapped. I went into the smaller one so I don&#39;t know if there was a baby changing station in the handicapped stall. <br><br>The food court at this Premium Outlets is really lacking (Ok, who am I kidding, it sucks!), so this restaurant is going to be very busy and popular (the huge menu and the huge selection of cheesecake flavors). Hubby mentioned that this could be one of our special occasion restaurants. Our first date was at the one at Forum Shops (back in 2004). So, yes, we will be back. It&#39;s a yummy place.

I LOVE the Cheesecake Factory!!!!! However, the management is SO RUDE. I come specifically for the Mango Key Lime Cheesecake and there was a mix up with inventory. The server was really nice and said there was one more left and comes back and says it was actually a mistake and there wasn&#39;t any. I asked to speak to the manager and Heather came and spoke to us saying it&#39;s not his fault there wasn&#39;t any which, of course it wasn&#39;t, but instead of apologizing for the mix up or trying to offer me another option she raised her voice and asked &#34;well did you specifically ask for it right when you sat down?&#34; Of course I didn&#39;t? I didn&#39;t appreciate her tone or how she approached the situation. I&#39;m honestly just really bummed about there not being my favorite cheesecake but how the management treated me, I&#39;m more upset about it. Point is, they need to work on their customer service.

Black Friday. The check in host was fabulous while as expected the lunch time wait and crowd on Black Friday was Crazy however she did a great job.<br>The fresh guacamole was NOT so fresh, it was brown.<br>The pot stickers seemed a little burnt and not in consistent with the one at Summerlin&#39;s Cheesecake Factory. <br>Our waiter was sweating you could see it on his forehead. He seemed overwhelmed which made us not want to ask for anything however we did ask for more bread which he forgot about and we never rec&#39;d. We were overcharged on our bill for wine. <br>Last year we came at the same time Black Friday and the food, service whole experience was perfect! Don&#39;t know what happened this year.

Knowing Cheesecake Factory, I personally try to steer away because of their food. Don&#39;t get me wrong. Their foods are mostly good but they also pack a punch in calories. So I was surprised when along with their regular menu, we were given a &#34;Skinnylicous&#34; one. It was so exciting! They listed all their food options and most of them are below 600 calories! Score!<br><br>We ordered appetizers and I settled with the Skinnylicious burger. It was surprisingly good! You would think that something like that would be more than 600 calories at least. I am really glad that they have this option available. I might consider dining here again if I&#39;m in the area and not be scared that I have no other options but unhealthy ones.

Friday night 9pm, just got in from Cali, the Bacon Bacon Burger is amazing! I had 2 slice of joy coupons and there was some flack from that, but there was no problem getting our free cheesecake. They ran out of Thousand Island dressing... I got the very last of it, just a smidgen. Service could have been better. When we asked to split the bill, it threw our server off. Ultimately everything worked in our favor. Beautiful decor. Bathroom is peraonal sized....only one stall, in which in a big restaurant like this, it should have a business sized bathroom.

Food was good, we had the Thai lettuce wraps omg they are so awesome! These are my new favorite thing. We also had a double double cheeseburger and quesadilla with chicken and the Cajun pasta. All dishes were really good, however I will return for those Thai wraps so good. I would give the Thai wraps alone 5 stars. Our server was pretty good and she has a great personality which is rare these days. We will return. The only two things that were bad was the restroom was broken so the line for women&#39;s room was long. Plus the seating area in front not of the kitchen is weird since you can see the staff eating right there.
First off, best cheesecake ever hands down. I had the firecracker snapper &amp; the sauce was amazing! I&#39;ve been searching for it since. This was my first time here &amp; I loved it.

Woohoo gluten free people. Cheesecake Factory loves us!! There are so many many chooses for you here. So please don&#39;t get scared and walk away... Look at the options.  Got one down the street so i know I can make a to go order and come and pick something good to enjoy at my house.1/2 of my pasta was cooked the other half was under cooked.  Shrimp tasted not cooked all the way. And I have always been a big fan of the Cheesecake Factory. But idk I am just saying. How do you have a huge Resturant and you only have two small tiny stalls in the bathrooms.  Really???? I think bathrooms need to be upgraded. <br>Our waitress was helpful when I went to tell her about my meal so she told the manager and he is suppose to come over and talk to me about. The manager was awesome and comped my meal. Wanted to give me another one. But I am full and am not wanting to eat anything else for the rest of the day.

Usually a favorite of our family, but,this was a mess. It is a Tuesday night at 6 PM and our waiter tells us they are out of a stuffed mushrooms appetizer, then we order loaded tater tots and they are out of that as well. My son then orders his Mac &amp; cheese burger and they tell us they are out of it. Now, wait a second, I am in the Food Distribution business and I know they get deliveries from their Food Distributor Monday, Wednesday, &amp; Friday. So, do not try and tell me you are out of this. So, 3 times you told this table of 9 customers, &#34;NO&#34;! Is that part of The Cheesecake Factory customer service strategy? I would bet not. So, let&#39;s top this off with my wife&#39;s Ahi Tuna salad, the tuna was bad and she could not eat it. My son orders Godiva Cheesecake to go and guess what, you got it, they where out. Unbelievable!! Worse service ever and disappointing in the fact that we spent over $300 for this.... This is why you should spend on independent restaurants. The Kitchen Manager &amp; Executive Chef should be embarrassed as they dropped the ball on their inventory and quality of food.

Food was horrible waited so long then they said it&#39;s by the door that opens it was cold and raining had to move wages were slow I did leave a big tip even though I shouldn&#39;t have and then when I open my strawberry cheesecake that I took home today it was half the cake was home with cream at the bottom and the cheesecake wasn&#39;t even there I&#39;ll never go to this one again horrible server with Kelly G

Cheesecake Factory never disappoints. I would&#39;ve given 5 stars but the hostess was not friendly at all when I requested a booth and it was not busy at all. It was a Monday evening and she looked like she hated being there, that&#39;s the vibe we received from her. But... we had an awesome server who was attentive and friendly. The food was great too. I had the bang bang chicken and shrimp with brown rice and my husband had the margarita pizza. Their ginger citrus cooler was delicious. Overall, we had a great dining experience and we will be back when we visit the area again.

Worst service ever.   Will NEVER be back.   Roxy the server  is the worst server.  We ordered an appetizer that took longer than the food to arrive.  When we asked when it will arrive, the response was: &#34;when it&#39;s ready&#34;!  Okaaaay!!!   And then after we ordered a different appetizer, 20 minutes go by then the manager ( I think) comes by to say: sorry folks.  We won&#39;t have that item till tomorrow.  WTF!!????   You know, when we walked in at 7 pm on a Friday night we were sat right away.  Initially I was shocked.  But after the worst service and food, I understand why.  This was by far the worst Cheesecake AND worst restaurant I have been to. EVER.   Stay away. They need to close down.  Really they do!  Awful.   Keep your money and spend it gambling! At least you&#39;ll have fun while watching your money go away to someone else&#39;s pocket!!!!!

We had an amazing experience at this location with our server named Travis. He was amazing from our drink orders all the way till the end. fast paced, and always on top of it. drinks always refilled &amp; he was always in the area if we needed something. definitely recommend this location &amp; ask for Travis next time you dine in. he was wonderful and made our Cheesecake Factory experience impeccable.

The food and is so good here! I have only been to a Cheesecake Factory 1 other time about 10 years ago. We went here for my daughters birthday- her choice. I got the top shelf margarita to start and hubby got the regular margarita(not sure what he was thinking)- mine was better, very good by the way!For dinner, I ordered the chicken francaise, the kids had pizza, the other had the spicy chicken sandwich( don&#39;t remember the name, sorry) off the adult menu, coconut chicken. We then proceeded to have dessert. All the kids, and their Aunt, ordered cheesecake( birthday cake and peanut butter), dad ordered the brownie sundae- he doesn&#39;t like cheesecake(his loss our gain). They all liked the,even my son who doesn&#39;t like cheesecake- he had the oreo one.  Everything was a hit. They sang to my daughter and put a candle in her cheesecake.  Great place! A little dark but a great place! I would definitely go back every day!

I love the cheesecakes, I think I&#39;ve probably tried each flavor given I work at the outlets! I only get take out but everything I&#39;ve gotten has been pretty good. <br><br>Although the service seems a bit inexperienced and lost at times they definitely are pretty nice, so I can deal with it. <br><br>Overall good food and exceptional service every time I&#39;ve been!

Went for happy hour and bar tender with the small ponytail and shaved sides couldn&#39;t make a basic Long Island Iced Tea . Literally calls for 4 liquors, FRESH LEMON &amp; a splash of coke. Some how sweet and sour mix got thrown in and it was theeeee worst happy hour. GO TO SUMMERLIN LOCATION FOR A BETTER EXPERIENCE!

Came in around 9:50 pm and it was a short wait to get seated thankfully. We ordered our food quickly but the food didn&#39;t come out for 20 minutes. We finished our bread and asked for more while waiting but the bread never came until we already had our food and had to ask a busser boy because our waitress was too busy or something. <br><br>I ordered the Baja Chicken Tacos. worst decision ever! The tortillas were very doughey and the rice had barely any taste. So i traded my brother for his Fettucine Alfredo because he didn&#39;t like it and you can never going wrong with that right? Wrong! The chicken had zero seasoning along with the pasta in general.<br><br>Everyone at my table had something wrong with their food, from hard spinach to doughey pizza. <br><br>At the time we got our food it was too late to even ask for them to remake it since they close at 11 pm! Plus we were starving. <br><br>The only thing that convinced me to give CCF 2 stars is how friendly the hostess was!
Walk in at 9pm.  Place is almost empty.  &#34;5 minute wait to seat you&#34;.<br><br>C&#39;mon....why do we have to stand there and look at empty tables?

One of my favorite places to eat -- love the avocado egg rolls! Hubby enjoys the Cajun seafood jambalaya. And the cheesecake, oh, the cheesecake! YUM! I love the mango key lime!  <br>At first I was disappointed in our waitress - we thought she had forgotten about us when she went to refill my Sprite, but she was changing the syrup so it wasn&#39;t straight soda water and the syrup spilled all over her - poor thing! She couldn&#39;t apologize enough for the accident, very sweet.

I love I mean love their cheesecake! Craig&#39;s carrot cheesecake is definitely my favorite but the time before last I went and got the Craig&#39;s carrot cake cheesecake and it was 90 percent carrot cake so this time I just wanted the cheesecake... I ordered the original cheesecake and from the get go the employees acted like I was bothering them.... Not a good welcome! Anyway I take the original cheesecake home and try to eat it.... Super mushy and the top was half cream cheese.... Now I could have gotten a firmer better tasting cheesecake from Jack in the box or Carl&#39;s jr.... I was highly disappointed with this trip to the cheesecake factory! I will give them another try but it will be a while when I spend almost $8 for a slice and I&#39;m unbappy

Outlet Mall. I have Celiac Disease and I ordered Gluten Free Four Cheese w/Chicken Pasta. It tasted great until I finished half of my meal.  See photos.  I specifically told the waiter I had Celiac Disease,  he indicated that he understood. My wife ordered spaghetti,  I would say the same strainer for her spaghetti was used for gluten free noodles.  Behind the scene, cross contamination inevitable.   The manager was apologetic and though I didn&#39;t pay monetarily for my meal,  I&#39;ll pay physically.

remember my first visit to a cheesecake factory 10+ years ago i was not impressed (different location of course). But every since I&#39;ve taken the time out to visit this location they&#39;ve been my new favorite , far as food goes!! service is Ehhh ! depending on who u ask ....recently went in for happy hour to enjoy and get better acquainted with the menu . Taking the chance to enjoy calamari , dynamite shrimp, crab artichoke dip, fried crab balls?, and one more item i can&#39;t quite remember. Everything was delicious for the most part ... oh yea stuffed mushrooms that came out cold... but dont worry they took them back and warmed them up before bringing them back for us to enjoy.Another issue i did have was noticing a couple with a kid who came in afterward, but receiving their drinks before we did ... but i took it out of his tip and made a  note of it , of course !!!

Worst place I&#39;ve ever eaten in Vegas. Not to mention the dirtiest bathroom in Vegas. Yesterday our group (3 adults, 2 children) went to dinner here. It was our first time at Cheesecake Factory and we were a little overwhelmed by the large menu. It took us a long time to make our selections with no advice from our server. She didn&#39;t bring us bread until we had been there an hour at least. When we ordered we waited and watched multiple tables come and go before being told by a manager that our food was being started and we should receive it soon. The kids got their food and we waited another 45 minutes before getting ours. No one got their food the way they ordered it and one of us had to wait for fries and another for rice (both key components to our meals). Our waitress was extremely rude and slow. When all was said and done we were there over 3 hours. Then later found out that she had charged the two credit cards multiple times (4x on one and 2x on the other). They had no sympathy at all when called about it. They left one of our party without funds to even eat while 2000 miles from home. <br>Worst restaurant experience ever!!!!!
Almond crusted Salmon salad. I order this all time at various locations and this is the smallest salad ever, barely any dressing and no avocado

Average Cheesecake Factory. It benefits from being the only sit down restaurant at the outlet shops. Our server was a little slow. The stella draft beer is $7.00! The shepherd&#39;s pie was super greasy and ferociously raced right through my digestive system. The enchiladas were a decent appetizer. Just keep your expectations low.

I absolutely love Cheesecake Factory. My girlfriend and I go here very frequently. However I usually go to the summerlin location. But I was over on this side of the town and decided to place a to-go order. So I called in to get a 4 cheese pasta with chicken for pickup and they said 15-20 minutes. Which wasn&#39;t a problem. However I got there in 10 minutes and just let them know I was there but they already had it ready for me. So I think they rushed cooking it. But I didn&#39;t pay much attention to it. But when I finally got home to try it out. It had a burnt taste to it. At first I thought it was from the to-go container and hot food mixing that threw off the taste but it was just overall burnt tasting. Hopefully next time I don&#39;t experience this because that was pretty disappointing. Other than this situation I&#39;ve never had a problem with Cheesecake Factory.
Something about their lasagna that it made taste different yet delicious.  Went on national cheesecake day &amp; although it was busy, still got awesome service.
This cheesecake factory was nice I guess I&#39;m used to the cheesecake factory is in LA where it&#39;s a little bit bigger and the service is a little faster but the food was good overall

New Cheesecake Factory at the Premium outlet in LV. The staff were all very nice and friendly. We came here Sunday branch and ordered a monte cristo and burlee French toast with a side of bacon. The food took awhile to prepare but the staff made it more enduring to wait. We got a refill of the wheat bread and butter. <br>For those of you who have been to the premium oUtlet in LV, Cheesecake Factory is a nice addition and hangout place while waiting for diehard shoppers.

Excited to have out of town Family come and try the Cheesecake Factory at the premium outlets. The Ladies bathroom was horrible, dirty and stuff all over the floors. Ordering asked about their Top Salads and my waiter said &#34;we have lots of salads? Then ordered a salad with blue cheese they ran out of blue-cheese dressing? Sitting for 15 min no bread no nothing? Oops yes we got our drinks. So disappointed compared to the Boca Park Cheese-Cake Factory. I will not return
Bad service and found a hair in my calimari. We won&#39;t be going back to this location.

Back again... Went to the Henderson location on Valentine&#39;s day and service took 15 minutes to get our waters and here we are again at the downtown location and it took 7 minutes for them to get back with us after seating so it&#39;s a little better.

Called in my order for curbside to go. I was told the order would be ready in 15 to 20 minutes. I arrived 15 minutes later and parked in the appropriate place. I called several times to let them know that I had arrived. 45 minutes later I went in to get my order. So much for curbside service. The managers excuse was simply, &#34; lack of communication from the front desk&#34;. And he also stated that this location don&#39;t get much business from curbside. <br>Unhappy customer.

Jesus was our waiter and he was AMAZING!  There&#39;s not much to say.  He went above and beyond and he was very enthusiastic about his job and his demeanor was super positive.  Definitely my best experience I ever had at any Cheesecake Factory.  Quite possibly one of the best services ever .  Food was delicious especially the white chocolate raspberry swirl...... heavenly!
Good value for money, the food was very good and so was the service. Not guide de Michelin but that&#39;s not what you pay for.

Had a terrible experience at this location. My server was rude and very short with us when we asked why our food was taking so long when other customers that came In 10 minutes after us already had their food, she instantly sent the manager over when we did not ask for him. The manager Chris Branch was very unprofessional and rude, he lacked the basic customer service skills that every employee should know. We waited 45 minutes for our food while we &#34;enjoyed&#34;our burnt appetizers, our waitress was no where to be found to tell her that we would like them remade. We didn&#39;t get to eat together the plates were brought out 10 minutes apart and 2 of the dishes were wrong we didn&#39;t have time to have the dishes remade because we had a child with us and the manager still charged us for the disappointing food and terrible service I expected more from this location.

My friend and I went to the Cheesecake Factory to celebrate her belated birthday. I asked our server nicely if he could put a candle on her cake, and he did not only put a candle on her cake, but they also turned her plate into a birthday plate, and had 5 servers sing Happy Birthday to her, which was super sweet. <br>We had the salty caramel cheesecake and chocolate mousse cheesecake. They were delicious! (The only bad thing about them is that it&#39;s just too much cake, cause let&#39;s face it - nobody needs 900 calories worth of cheesecake.) ;) We ate about half of it, and our server put the rest in boxes for us so we could bring it home. <br><br>All in all we had a really good birthday celebration, and looooved those cheesecakes!

This might be the branch that has the RUDEST employees! So we just wanted to have a happy family dinner and when we entered there was a waiting list, so we checked in and the front desk said we have to wait for 40 minutes and we said &#34;Ok, thank you.&#34; Then we sat down on a couch that is near to the front desk so we can hear them if they call us. <br>    <br>     A while later, we asked how many more minutes do we have to wait and this guy told us that we&#39;re gonna be called next because we were in front of the line. A few minutes, we still weren&#39;t called. So we told another guy that 40 minutes passed already and we haven&#39;t been called, so he checked in the computer he said that we&#39;ve been called 10 times! We were like &#34;We didn&#39;t get called at all!&#34; We were so near to the front desk and we know we didn&#39;t get called. <br><br>     So we went to the manager and he got us a table and he said that it was no big deal. But it was a big deal, they were lying and unfair because we were a party of 5 and they called parties of 6 ,7, 4. They said that we weren&#39;t called just yet because our party was more than a party of 4! They were being unfair and dishonest. I hope my experience help you when you come to this branch.

I love Cheesecake Factory, and was craving for some pasta. So, I ordered their Louisiana Chicken Pasta in hopes that it will satisfy my cravings. I ordered the food to go, and half way through eating it, I found a hair on my food. Mind you, I am a female with long brown hair, and this strand that I found was a short, thick, black hair. Definitely not mine! It made me gag, and I was sooo disappointed. I&#39;m not one to write a bad review on Yelp, but I was just really disappointed this happened.

First let me start by saying that its impossible to get any sort of intimate accommodations at a chain restaurant especially one as big as the cheesecake factory. However, from the first five minutes here i found the most courteous and sincere employee here was SKYLER,  the front of house manager. He is attentive, and provides excellent service with a smile and great attitude. He goes above and beyond to ensure that your experience is of the highest caliber and provides way more service than some of the most high end restaurants. Overall the atmosphere was a pleasure and it was mostly so because of his service. I definitely recommend this particular cheesecake to any one that appreciates good service!

Super slow service. Requested a change in our seating and server never flagged down the hostess for us until we did ourselves. No drink refills either. I don&#39;t think the waiter was trained enough to take care of the entire patio section by himself. <br><br>Food was mediocre as well. Jambalaya was extremely dry and the salad was dumped in dressing. I&#39;ve definitely had better at other Cheesecake locations. I was swamped after hours of walking and shopping but then this experience just made it worse...

I&#39;ve been a Cheesecake Factory fan since &#39;98, it is a serious addiction.  I used to catch the #11 bus downtown transfer get on the trolley from EAST San Diego to Fashion Valley Mall that&#39;s how serious it WAS and IS!  B<br>So on to the review:<br><br>I really like this new location at the premium outlets, $6 for valet parking (so worth it).  Just like other CF locations there was a wait to be seated in the restaurant area BUT the bar area is open availability.  <br><br>The lunchtime options is more than enough food for a lunch portion.  I ordered SHEILA&#39;S GRILLED CHICKEN &amp; AVOCADO salad.  This lunch portion can be split in two, salad is tossed with a citrus honey vinaigrette.  Piled high are mixed greens, grilled chicken, cashews, shredded carrots, red onion, crunchy tortilla strips, cilantro and of course AVOCADO!  No need to search for the chicken, every stab of the fork you come up with piece of chicken.  Remember, this is ONLY the lunch portion, the dinner size might feed an entire table of 4, ijs.  The salad was DRESSED not soggy, still had crisp to the lettuce and crunch to the cashews.<br><br>for dessert:<br>SALTED CARAMEL CHEESECAKE<br>Um, yea...I kind of was disappointed with this selection, for me personally the graham cracker crust was too thick, the base was basic, what made it salted caramel was that a layer of caramel sits atop of the cheesecake.  Yea, that&#39;s all I have to say about that<br><br>Of course the cheesecake does not effect the star rating, I will just try a different cheesecake, they have over 20 different flavors.  But this is just my opinion , go try it out you might go giddy over the salted caramel cheesecake.

We went down to Cheesecake Factory ahead of a busy day of shopping and a show at the Smith Center. I usually don&#39;t like Cheesecake Factory because they tend to take a bit longer to serve you, but this time it was super speedy. We ordered some lunch specials and a Shepherd&#39;s Pie. The Pie was really good, although it was a bit fancier than some of the Pies I&#39;ve ordered at other places before. Overall, I really enjoyed my meal. The food was good, the service was good, the speed and price were right -- really, nothing to complain about. The only thing that keeps me from giving this place 5 stars is that I was not wowed by anything, but I do appreciate that everything was solidly good.

Probably should not have come on National Cheesecake Day. It was a zoo, and disorganized. Was escorted to a table that already had people at it, after we had waited for over 45 minutes after we were told 30 min wait. Husband ordered the jambalaya and it was dry, asked for more sauce. Ordered Swiss mushroom burger medium and it was not. Already had waited for my food didn&#39;t wait for them to redo it, and there is always the fear someone will do something to your food.
